reviews.name: Jim Pandise
reviews.title: The most amazing place I've visited
reviews.comment: This park is unique and mesmerizing. Give yourself two days here. One day to get familiar with the entire park on a driving tour and then take a horse back or hiking trip to get in amongst the HooDoos. Better than the Grand Canyon!

reviews.name: AlpinerHut
reviews.title: #3 among Utah's Mighty 5 national parks
reviews.comment: #3 in my rankings of Utah's Mighty 5 national parks. Hey, twice in my life I've looked at a natural wonder and thought, "This CAN'T be real. I must be on another planet." The first was the Grand Canyon. The second? Bryce Canyon National Park. But I personally give it "bad" marks because it's so hard to do the best activity in this park: hiking down (and, dear God!, back up) among the hoodoos. At 68, I tried a short descent and return and about died! From the rim, it's frustrating to see but not be able to "touch."

reviews.name: deni1661
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery and plenty of hiking trails!
reviews.comment: We really enjoyed our visit to this national park. We spent a day and half in Bryce Canyon and we spent another day at Kolob Canyon - both were spectacular! There were many different cliffs and hoodoos that were simply majestic. The scenic overlooks and hiking trails were well marked making it easy to get through the park. There are plenty of trail options from easy to strenuous. We went at the end of October so the crowds were very manageable - still plenty of people but not anything that hindered our plans. The only negative to our visit was the very rude and unhelpful park ranger at the visitor center.

reviews.name: kevan j
reviews.title: A great half day in Bryce!
reviews.comment:
We had about a half day to spend in Bryce on our way through. I think we did a pretty good job planning it out. We got started about sunrise, but there were clouds in the sky. So rather than go directly to Sunset Point, we drove the long road out to Rainbow and Yovimpa Points, stopping at some of the overlooks along the way. The views were very nice, but my favorite was the Natural Bridge Overlook, which featured a beautiful natural bridge so close we could almost touch it. Once we arrived at Rainbow Point, we spent about a half hour just walking along the edge looking down into an amphitheater I've never seen before. It is not quite as spectacular as the main Bryce Amphitheater, but it was vast and it was beautiful, and I've wanted to come here for many years. It also had a lot more "green" in it. We proceeded to hike the Bristlecone Loop Trail, which included Yovimpa overlook. This was a fairly easy and enjoyable hike. Unfortunately, it seems that most of the bristlecones have seen better days. I definitely recommend this hike. It helped me to feel like I'd seen the "entire" park, rather than just the front-end like most visitors.
We then drove back to the Sunset Point, stopping briefly at Inspiration Point for some good views of the main amphitheater. The colors were stunning by now as the sun had emerged from the clouds and we had a perfect side view of the valley. Upon arriving at Sunset Point, we hiked up to the rim and then completed a very nice loop trail that went down into the canyon. We started by following the Rim Trail from Sunset Point to Sunrise Point. We then hiked down along the Queens Garden Trail. The trail was a bit steep, but high quality and not too crowded. At this point I realized the reviews were correct in noting that the best views in Bryce are from beneath the rim. Magnificent! Truly marvelous! Once we reached the junction with the Navajo Loop Trail, we turned and hiked up to the rim. Wall Street is closed this time of year, but the Navajo Trail was still great. I must admit, it was a bit steep, but the views were so beautiful that the steepness was hardly noticeable. We saw the Two Towers and Thor's Hammer and we noted all the pine trees along the trail that somehow get enough sunlight to grow tall.
Overall, Bryce is an amazing park. I would definitely recommend coming here in late October and/or early November like we did as the weather was cool, the crowds were virtually non-existent, and the little dabs of snow here and there spiced things up a bit.

reviews.name: Zemin H
reviews.title: amazing place
reviews.comment:
Entering Bryce Canyon NP in the morning, I once again marveled at the extraordinary craftsmanship of nature. The crumbling rocks stand tenaciously, and the wrinkles washed out by wind and rain seem to tell the vicissitudes of ages. Against the background of the blue sky and white clouds, the ochre-colored rocks are just beautiful. So far so good. We decided to take the Two Bridges from Sunset Point first. Although the trail was short, the switchbacks on the steep hill trigger my unrecovered thigh soreness from Angels Landing climb. After a short break at noon, I went to the Queens Garden from Sunrise Point. Unexpectedly, the weather changed suddenly on the way, the temperature dropped very quickly, and the snow started to drift. I temporarily changed the plan and went through the loop from Sunrise Point to Sunset Point. Finding Victoria Queen hoodoo in the wind and snow, walking through the various stone forests, is also a different experience. There were only few cars left when we returned to the once crowded parking lot. Next morning we came to Sunrise Point to watch the sunrise, the warm morning light illuminates the stone forest making them looks translucent.
The local Indian tribe is Navajo. According to their legend, Coyote will petrify people with bad deed into sculptures here.

reviews.name: fiamma11
reviews.title: Beautiful Bryce
reviews.comment: Photographs cannot capture the beauty of Bryce Canyon. It truly is remarkably beautiful and distinctive. This is definitely one of the national parks that you want to make a point to visit.

reviews.name: spitzy135
reviews.title: Amazing Even in the Rain
reviews.comment:
Even though the day started out as pouring rain and foggy, Bryce Canyon still stole the show with its spectacular scenery. Bryce is so different from all the other parks and is truly amazing.
We were touring Utah in early October and only had one day to see the park. We are not big hikers, so we were just planning to drive to the pullouts and see the easy viewpoints. We thought because of the weather it was going to be a total wash out. To our surprise, we were still able to see the incredible hoodoos from most of the viewpoints. Scenery past the hoodoos in the distance was pretty foggy, but it made for some interesting pictures! What saved our visit was the fact that you can see so much of the park right from the pullouts, without any major hikes.
All of the pullouts are on the left, so definitely drive to the end first, and visit the viewpoints going back. We were especially impressed with Inspiration Point. That was our choice for the best sunrise viewpoint. Oh well, maybe next time! Natural Bridge was another favorite, it was stunning, especially with the fall colors. And it is a very short walk to see the view. Also make a point to see Fairyland Point. It is actually outside the entrance, and is easily missed. It is not mentioned much, but it has a very impressive view of the hoodoos and photographs well.
Pay attention to the temperature forecasts, because Bryce is much colder than surrounding areas because of its elevation at 7000 to 9000 feet. In the early morning in October it was in the low 40’s. Stay hydrated too, to avoid altitude sickness, especially if hiking.
We were so impressed with Bryce Canyon, even in the rain, so we will try it again the next time we are in Utah, and look forward to tackling some of the easier hikes.

reviews.name: MKTBE
reviews.title: WOW! Amazing National Park!
reviews.comment:
We try to visit at least one new National Park every year, and this year was Bryce Canyon! The views are as amazing as every picture you have ever seen. How was the spectacular canyon and it's hoodoos formed? - The natural forces of weathering and erosion, from ice and rain created Bryce Canyon. What once was a plateau, the rocks ha e broken down, and eventually became the incredible individual hoodoos.
We love to travel in the Fall to avoid the massive crowds and the extreme temperatures of summer. In late October the weather (mid 50°) was perfect for sightseeing and hiking. We were able to get 8 to 12 miles of hiking on each day of our two day visit, on the wonderfully maintained park trails. The views from Sunset, Sunrise, Inspiration, and Bryce Point were all amazing, but the real adventure is experiencing it from inside the canyon! We can't wait to return!
Only a few small negatives! Too few bathroom facilities, next to no food options, and a lot of the park signage needs refreshing.

reviews.name: Robert P
reviews.title: The view almost leaves you speechless.
reviews.comment: This is one of those parks that you truly have to visit to appreciate. My wife and I were getting toward the end of our National Parks tour, but are glad we made the effort to see Bryce Canyon. The Hoodoes are incredible; and it makes you wonder how this came to be.

reviews.name: Travelingw6
reviews.title: Beautiful elevations. Nice hike!
reviews.comment: We visited in late October so it was cold. The trails had icy parts then got muddy the lower we hiked in the valley. The views up high were nice. Recommend an early start for best parking choices. It is a busy park with tours. The trails got more crowded the later the am got. Our 8 year old was fine but the 4 yr old needed help due to age and drop offs.

reviews.name: Tom F
reviews.title: Favorite Park
reviews.comment: Wow just wow!. One of my favorite National Parks. The views are spectacular. You can drive the whole park. Or take the shuttle on the Bryce overlook loop. Plan on o e day if you are not hiking the trails.

reviews.name: Joebob747
reviews.title: Speachless
reviews.comment: We did 7 national parks on our trip. Grand Canyon runs a close second, but I really think Bryce is my favorite. First time here and just in awe seeing the amphitheater. We spent one full day and one evening here. The photo ops never end. I suggest that if you want to see the whole park, you drive always to the end and work your way back. Most of the viewpoints are on your right side then. There is a shuttle you can ride, but from what I can tell, it only runs to part of the park and not very early or late.

reviews.name: Amy J
reviews.title: Amazing hike on the Navajo Loop
reviews.comment: We hiked the Navajo Loop on a snowstorm. Thank goodness this trail was open as most of the rest of the park road was closed. The elevation from tip of the hike to the bottom involved about 24 switchbacks but worth every step. Hiking boots and poles were a must have especially with the snow!

reviews.name: JKL V
reviews.title: Another spectacular Mighty 5!
reviews.comment: Bryce NP is one of the Utah Mighty 5! Bryce NP is unique with its own beautiful sights, just like Arches and Canyonlands have their own unique spectacular sights to offer visitors. Lots of trails to hike and they are manageable. Most of the roads in Bryce are paved so a regular sedan vehicle will do just fine.

reviews.name: UKVISIT
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon beautiful
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is a beautiful park and dixie forest driving into that is equally as nice. Bryce can be done in a day unless you are big into hiking. We saw lots of wildlife which was wonderful and unexpected.

reviews.name: pennykurz3
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: The hoodoos are so beautiful that I can’t even describe them. If you are traveling with small children, use extreme caution. Most of the canyon rim has been left in its natural form and is not fenced. I will definitely be making a return trip next year.

reviews.name: Jill D
reviews.title: Very pretty view.
reviews.comment: The Visitor's Center staff were very friendly. The shuttle drivers were too. The hiking is good and the views were great. It was cold and they say the shuttles will only be another week. Still a lot of people though.

reviews.name: joe-d
reviews.title: Nyce-ly Extraordinary
reviews.comment: How fortunate we were to add Bryce to our 5,000 mile + road trip. Scenery invaded the senes and left us wonderfully wounded with a lifetime's worth of memory-visuals. Verdict: Just go!

reviews.name: giwpriestap
reviews.title: What colors!
reviews.comment: We visited several areas of the main "drag" of Bryce Canyon and the views and the COLORS were phenomenal! Make sure to do the Queensway and the Navajo Loop trail for some spectacular views. The shuttle was running and it's pretty good for biking too.

reviews.name: Steve S
reviews.title: A unique place of natural wonder but do not rush it.
reviews.comment:
Many visitors blow through the park in a day but that does not allow enough time to see the sites in different lighting conditions or to enjoy many of the hikes.
Weather reports indicated a good chance of rain during our 4 day stay and the clouds that came with it were a real bonus.
We also had enough time to catch the local White tailed prairie dogs antics.

reviews.name: Our America
reviews.title: Exploring the park
reviews.comment: Breathtaking views of sandstone rock formations. Colors are glowing with reds. off white, brown. The canyon fits the description of The Lost World of Atlantis. Roads are wide enough ro easily navigate around the park. Spectacular.

reviews.name: Richard C
reviews.title: Do not miss this
reviews.comment: Words cannot describe the beauty of this park. No other park has views that match this park. Parking can be tough but shuttle busses from the visitor center provide easy transportation. There is an entrance fee. If you plan to visit more than one park in the year buy the pass for all parks for the year … $80 a car which includes at least 4 occupants, maybe more. Must buy a month in advance because you need a paper pass or buy at gate of one of the parks. Check it out.

reviews.name: Linette J
reviews.title: Quiet and stunning
reviews.comment: The scenery is otherworldly! The setting in the ponderosa pine forest is restful and lovely. Many services NOT available due to Covid restrictions. The town outside the park has services available and it a quick drive. Nice campground. The park was not as busy as many in the area. Give yourself a couple days to enjoy the quiet and the scenery, several days if you prefer to hike.

reviews.name: Parker Sturbridge
reviews.title: Parker says "Simply amazing and breathtaking"
reviews.comment: Simply amazing and breathtaking. There's nowhere else like it. It is at a fairly high altitude, so be careful and don't overexert. Hydrate too. Wear good walking shoes, as there are a number of trails with loose gravel and no guard rails. Even if you are 'height challenged' (not short, just afraid of heights), suck it up and check it out. You'll never see anything like it.

reviews.name: TotalOfFive
reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.comment:
This place is "other worldly". We hiked the "figure 8" which includes part of Wall Street, Navajo, Peek a Boo, and Queen's Garden trails. It took about 4 hours only because we stopped a lot to take pictures and marvel at the hoodoos. It isn't a particularly difficult hike as the trail is not too narrow and it is well defined. However, there is a lot of up and down.
We used trekking poles and were glad we had them.

reviews.name: KSavani
reviews.title: Amazing Park views.
reviews.comment: Go to the park early to avoid the crowds. The temperature was perfect. A little cold in the morning, but warmed up quickly as we started hiking. Stop at the visitor center to get information from the rangers about the park and how you can plan your day, based on weather, expected crowds, and fitness ability. Take your time to relax and enjoy the park. Take a picnic lunch, and use one of the picnic tables available. Hike a couple trails. We hiked Queen's Garden and Wall Street. Sunset to Sunrise. We stopped at all the lookout points. We drove the length of the park. Breathe the fresh air. Couldn't ask for a better day. Best part about this trip was the drive on Hwy 12 from Capitol Reef Park. Just Amazing. Of the five Utah national parks, this had the easiest and shortest hiking options. My boys (16 and 12) enjoyed the other parks better. Much cooler than the others because of the elevation.

reviews.name: Sidney Q
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: The hoodoo are breathtaking. This is another "must to see" as so many do each year. Each turn brings another site to behold.

reviews.name: chins01
reviews.title: Quick trip but worth it!
reviews.comment:
We only had about 4 hours to check out Bryce. While this really isn't enough it was definitely worth the stop over and if we're passing through the area again we'll be sure to spend more time here. We started by doing the scenic drive. We drove out to Rainbow Point ( the second to last point), which had stunning views. It was hard to find parking here but well worth the effort. We then drove back towards the entrance, hitting many of the scenic view points along the way back. There was a food truck at one of them so we were able to do a quick picnic lunch before starting a hike. Many of the popular hiking trails start at Sunset and Sunrise Point so parking in those areas was also difficult. We ended up parking at the Bryce lodge's visitor parking, which is located between the two points. It was a quick walk to the Sunset/Sunrise path from there. That path alone has stunning views, but from there we connected to the Navajo Loop trail. We started by hiking down to Wall Street and then doing Two Bridges on the way back up. If you have limited time to hike Wall Street is definitely the area you want to see.
On a side note, we lucked and ended up going to Bryce on a free day. We didn't know they had free days. If you don't have then annual national parks pass it's worth checking online to see if there are any upcoming free days before planning your visit as the normal cost is $35/car.

reviews.name: Anthony C
reviews.title: Bryce is a wonderland.
reviews.comment: Bryce is a wonderland. This Park is absolutely spectacular and breathtaking views abounded. Though less popular than some of the national parks, it is a “must see.” They are many different vantage points that have incredible views of the hoodoos. If you are a hiking enthusiast, Bryce is the place for you.

reviews.name: zephyr99
reviews.title: Incredible beautiful; Poor enforcement of masks in buildings, etc
reviews.comment: I would have given Bryce 5+ stars as it is an amazing Ntl Park with great hiking paths. Having been to a number of Ntl Parks over the past month it is the first to show a blatant snd consistent disregard for the enforcement of visitors to wear masks and social distancing in all buildings. In addition, the Ntl Park team at Bryce had the most minimal signage across the various park buildings advising people to mask up. Very very disappointed in the Bryce Ntl Park Staff and their employees.

reviews.name: ConfederateMike
reviews.title: Spend the day here to explore
reviews.comment: We spent a day hiking around the rim of the canyon and down into it on the Navajo Loop Trail. The views are spectacular. You really appreciate the beauty after hiking down into the canyon and looking back up. I must say you will need to take your time hiking to enjoy all that is there to see. The trails are tame enough for most to travel so just about anyone can take part in this park.

reviews.name: jetsly
reviews.title: Great hiking and great photography await!
reviews.comment:
If you are a hiking enthusiast, Bryce is a wonderland. But even if you come here just to enjoy the views, you should budget about 4 hours to drive through the park and stop at the many viewpoints.
Virtually everything in Bryce that cries out for a photograph is situated to the east of the park road, so it's easy to find great panoramic shots, great shots where the rocks are bathed in light or muted by shadows, but you will have only a few chances to film light and shadow in tandem. In the early morning or late afternoon, look for viewpoints that lay out the rocks in a half circle, one face in shadow and the other in light. Bryce is one of our most photogenic parks ... and don't forget the stretch of UT 12 east of the traffic circle. There are some great vistas between the circle and Tropic, and beyond Tropic UT 12 is one of America's most scenic byways. If you are heading for Moab, this is the route to take!

reviews.name: Marilyn S
reviews.title: Wow! Just wow!
reviews.comment: This park is absolutely spectacular and breathtaking views abounded. My husband had a scooter and was able to use it at the viewing areas and on the shared path. Though less popular than some of the national parks, it is a “must see.” The drive up to Rainbow Point is worth the time because you rise above the hoodoos, getting a different vantage point, and there are many incredible viewpoints along the way.

reviews.name: Andrea C
reviews.title: Great Day Trip
reviews.comment: This park has amazing views. You can take guided tours or you can just take in the drive and do your own tour with the sight seeing pull off throughout the park. It was amazing. We did our own tour through the park and loved it. Bathrooms were clean and well kept up for out houses. Plenty of easy walking spots all the way to intense trails to choose from. easy to get too look out points.

reviews.name: Alexandra T
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon National Park is absolutely amazing. There is a free shuttle that runs all day to a few stops inside the park.

reviews.name: ms57-ny
reviews.title: Truly Stunning
reviews.comment: One of the most amazingly beautiful places in the world. Stunning views of the hoodoos-the naturally eroded formations viewable from the many points and the hikes along the canyon rim. Gorgeous colors that change with the time of day and your perspective at the various points.. Park rangers give short informative talks about the nature of the rock formations.

reviews.name: tammiew101416
reviews.title: Absolutely breathtaking!
reviews.comment: This is an amazingly beautiful National Park. We went late in the afternoon to one section and in the morning to another part. The way the sun hits these hoodoos depending on the time of day is spectacular.

reviews.name: EilSat
reviews.title: A Place I will never forget
reviews.comment: Beautiful rock formations. Amazing views. Unbelievable colors. Some of the trees were destroyed by lightening fires. The tour guide said it was natural causes. The paths in the canyon are very peaceful. Nature at its finest. Sturdy shoes and rugged clothes recommended.

reviews.name: stevene254
reviews.title: Beauty at every turn
reviews.comment: Visiting as many parks as we can on this trip. Got to the park early and saw the early morning light on the canyon. We drove to rainbow point and made several stops along the way. Every stop was unique and had vistas that took your breath away. Rainbow point is the highest drivable vista in the park and gives you a breathtaking view of the canyon. The welcome center is full of information and plenty of park Rangers to help. The film was informative and worth sticking around for. The Bryce Canyon Inn was also worth the side trip to visit, having period funiture and pictures of past experiences in the park.

reviews.name: James A
reviews.title: Idiots at Bryce
reviews.comment: Fire the entire staff starting at the top idiot All the way to the bottom idiots. Extremely rude!!!!!!!!!!!!! Oh and if you want to wear a mask they are going to make sure that they tell you what an idiot you are for protecting my fellow man and myself. WHAT A COMPLETE WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.name: kimekstrom
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Incredible scenery within short, easy walks of parking. Driving all the way to the end of the canyon road and stopping at each pull out is well worth it.

reviews.name: eclectic80498
reviews.title: My favorite NP
reviews.comment: What can I say? Bryce is unique, and we have been here several times. The views are fabulous, and there isn't anything much like it in the world. Take a horseback ride, which goes down to the base of the canyon, a great experience.

reviews.name: John A
reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.comment: Another National Park that should not be missed. I drove from Capitol Reef turning South on Utah 12, traversing Dixie National Forest much of the way. It is a winding road and needs your attention as there are many miles of unmatched scenery. The park is amazing and offers several options based on the time you have available. As I was passing through, I opted for a nearby by overlook that is simply breathtaking. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: 122helene
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment:
Breathtaking, it is so beautiful. I have been to a lot of the national parks in southern Utah, and this is just amazing. In Utah you keep getting amazed, but Bryce Canyon is on the top of the list.
Everything is seems easy at the park, easy access to everthing.

reviews.name: DrMFM
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon Tour
reviews.comment: We had Faith as our guide. She was exceptional in providing history of the area and pointing out the more interesting formation of the hoodoos. An enthusiastic person.

reviews.name: Denise R
reviews.title: RUBY'S INN AND CAMPGROUND Is THE PLACE TO STAY! AMAZING!!
reviews.comment:
Aside from the wonder of Bryce, RUBY'S INN AND CAMPGROUND is the only place to stay!! The Bryce Canyon shuttle stops right there to take you through the park. We were at the to campground which is pristine, but we also saw the Inn and the other hotels all onsite. There is a shuttle that will pick you up from your campsite or hotel room and bring you to any of the be 3 restaurants onsite, the huge general store, the cute little Old Town Bryce stores, or Soar Utah. This is a virtual reality ride that takes you soaring over the parks of Utah with a 360 degree view! It was so beautiful, I cried.
Finally, we ate at Ebenezer's Barn and Grill which served great food and had a wonderful country music show. Soo worth it! Finally there is a rodeo on most days.

reviews.name: World_Traveler_DR
reviews.title: Stunning views
reviews.comment: One of the best National Parks in the USA, I feel it rivals Grand Canyon. Stunning scenery at every turn of the road. I regret not being there for sunrise, as it faces east and the colors would have been amazing. Enter the park and drive the 18 miles to the end and then drive back stopping at each overlook, a real treat for the eyes and senses. The amphitheater near the lodge is stunning, however many other locations are also great.

reviews.name: garbagecollector
reviews.title: Go in the morning
reviews.comment:
Well, let's see. What can I say that hasn't been said already?
We went in the morning. I had been to Bryce Canyon 4 times in the past, but never seen the morning sun hitting the spires. This time I saw it, and it is spectacular! Not only that, there were little to no crowds, and we saw plenty of deer and other critters running around.
My advice, go in the morning (or maybe the evening). You will be amazed how the light plays on each viewpoint.

reviews.name: lucsimsthomas
reviews.title: Simply beautiful
reviews.comment:
We arrived at this park in the late morning on a Saturday while on the way to Moab. We parked in the lot across from the visitors center and then told one of the rangers that we only had a few hours to visit. He suggested the Rim Trail as a way to see a lot of what the park has to offer in one short visit.
We took the free shuttle that is offered and got off near the start of the trial. Right from the start, the views were mind-boggling. It's a long trail but worth every step to catch the sites we were able to see.
As we made our way along the trail we saw hoodoos, gorgeous cliffs, the amphitheater and so many beautiful and colorful formations. There was even a chipmunk who was smart enough to pose for photos at one of the stopping points.
When we got to the lodge we were very hungry and glad to be able to buy sandwiches and drinks before catching the shuttle back to the visitor center to leave.

reviews.name: photoguy_10
reviews.title: Better Than Zion in my Opinion!
reviews.comment: The national park is different and much prettier and fun to hike than Zion. We were at Zion the day prior and like Bryce so much more. So many trails to do and see. Don't get me wrong, Zion is amazing as well!

reviews.name: Joe
reviews.title: Magnificent !
reviews.comment: My wife and I had this park on our bucket list for quite some time and we were not disappointed. The very first view and many others are simply breathtaking. It is amazing to see God's hand in all this. This is a must see when in the area.

reviews.name: Michael L
reviews.title: One of my favorites
reviews.comment: It is hard to compare National Parks but if you could, this is a favorite just due to the multiple colors, the green of the ever greens mixed with the red and brown of the sandstone from the hoodoos! Amazing! The Grand Canyon but prettier!

reviews.name: bilberrymom
reviews.title: Our favorite national park
reviews.comment: This was the third time my husband and I visited Bryce Canyon National Park. The first time (2002) I had a Peterson's or Fodor's Guide of Utah. (I forget which one.) The book said that if you only visit one national park, it should be Bryce. I would have to concur with that statement. The park is BEAUTIFUL! There are so many varied hoodoos, and they are just stunning. They are so unique and beautiful. My husband agrees that this is his favorite national park, and we have visited 41 so far. We highly recommend the Canyon Trail Ride (half day is the most worthwhile) and hiking the Queen's Garden/Navajo Loop trail. We've done both on the same day each visit. (Separate reviews on each of these are available for more information.) You can't go wrong with a visit to this park.

reviews.name: granof03
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: We visited several National Parks on this vacation and I found Bryce Canyon to be the most beautiful. The beauty and diversity of the landscape is difficult to describe. We hiked a couple of the trails and saw a lot of beautiful formations. This park was on my wish list and so glad that we got to see it.

reviews.name: bethanynd
reviews.title: A 100 on on a 10 point scale!
reviews.comment: This was my 4th visit to Bryce Canyon and it never disappoints. We were lucky to find a room at the BC Lodge, which is a 5 min walk to the rim. The park offers shuttle service to the major lookout points but the rim area between sunset point and sunrise point is flat, paved and easy for anyone (even with mobility challenges) to enjoy the scenery. We hiked the Navajo Trail through Wall Street (amazing slot-like canyon) and then caught Peek A Boo trail (counter clockwise). Our original plan was to do the "figure 8" of these two trails totaling around 6 miles but it was hot and we were running low on water. We detoured up the trail to Bryce Point and caught a shuttle back to Sunset (where we started). There are compost toilets in the summer on Peek A Boo near Bryce point but there's no water. The park did not feel crowded in mid-July. There was steady flow of visitors but once you're a quarter mile from the rim on a trail you're not seeing many people. This is by far one of our favorite parks. It's not stressful due to crowds, it offers basic services (food, lodging, bathrooms with running water) and more honestly enjoyable than the madness we experienced at Zion & Arches.

reviews.name: Arpana V
reviews.title: One of my favorite national parks
reviews.comment: The hoodoos are breathtaking especially when the light shines through them at sunrise. The various shades of the amphitheater keep you spellbound as you hike through. Having the shade periodically keeps you from getting too dehydrated.

reviews.name: Rodney A
reviews.title: Amazing landscap
reviews.comment: Beautiful views of the incredible landscape. We were only here for a day but it seems we saw a lot in a short period of time.

reviews.name: Karen C
reviews.title: Absolutely Stunning
reviews.comment: Bryce is my favorite national park! Unique and beautiful scenery, perfect hiking weather on a morning in July, with great lookout points. The Queens Garden/Navajo hike was our favorite.

reviews.name: Sandy M
reviews.title: Best of the Best!
reviews.comment: Out of all the National Parks, the views at Bryce Canyon are the most spectacular! You can either take a bus through the park or drive. There are tours available and great places to hike. Our favorite National Park due to the spectacular view. We have been more than once and hope to go back.

reviews.name: maldenmusic
reviews.title: Most Beautiful Park!
reviews.comment: This place is simply stunning! Start at the Visitor Center and work your way up to the high point. There are plenty of pull off places and you can stop for the views. There are trails, picnic tables and informational signs. The amphitheater near the Visitor Center is too large to capture in a photo. We've visited several times and this place always amazes me.

reviews.name: ThoughtsFromAPage
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful Park
reviews.comment: Bryce is now one of my favorite national parks. It is absolutely stunning and the rangers are friendly and helpful. The park controls the crowds well unlike Zion and it was not overrun with people. I would return here in a heartbeat.

reviews.name: The Mission Makers
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: A very unique park with its Hoodos, pines, and spectacular views. Great hiking, biking, horseback riding, and star gazing. One of the best night skies in the entire USA.

reviews.name: 1hawkeye72
reviews.title: Best trails
reviews.comment: We did the Navajo Loop/Queen’s Garden Trail. Went counter clockwise as advised by other reviews. Def the way to go and while not easy, we are in our 60’s and it was fine. Awesome views around every corner.

reviews.name: Empty Nesters
reviews.title: Amazing Views!
reviews.comment: We visited Bryce Canyon National Park in late July. The weather at the canyon was much cooler than many of the surrounding areas. Unfortunately due to rain, all of the trails inside the canyon was closed. I appreciate the availability of the shuttle bus, but we chose to drive to each of the scenic points. Parking was limited, but we never had an issue. The ridge trail was open as well as the visitor center. The park has amazing views from every location. It is worth the trip even if you only have 2-3 hours and only stop along the ridge trail. This is a must see National Park if you are in the area. I hope to go back someday when we can hike the trials.

reviews.name: Harleysville_Bill
reviews.title: So worth a visit!
reviews.comment: This is an awesome park with plenty of good hiking. We went as a group in July and it did not feel overcrowded with people. The staff we interacted with were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. This made for and overall great experience.

reviews.name: stay-home-mom-pa
reviews.title: Great National Park
reviews.comment: Great trails and views of the Hoodoo's. Park at Sunset Point and then hike through the Hoodoo's. The paths are easier to maneuver that direction. Take lots of water and snacks and enjoy the views.

reviews.name: Tony B
reviews.title: Totally Worth It
reviews.comment: We decided to stop here the night before on our way through the area. We were glad we did! Great scenery and amazing colors.

reviews.name: Matthew J
reviews.title: Heavenly Hoodoo View
reviews.comment:
Tip: Drive to the end of the scenic drive before doubling back so that most of the stops will be on the right side and easier to pull over to.
In my opinion, Bryce is much more beautiful than Zion. All of the trails we hiked had simply spectacular views, felt safe, and most felt friendly for children and seniors. Photos simply do not do Bryce justice; the scenery is definitely distinct from Zion (although it's only a two-hour drive away), with the largest concentration of hoodoos in the whole world. Just make sure to dress warmly because it's much colder in Bryce. All in all, definitely stop by for a magnificent day in Bryce!

reviews.name: redundantecho
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL!!!
reviews.comment: You can drive through the park or park at the visitors center and catch a shuttle. I highly recommend the shuttle. It comes around each stop every 12-15 minutes. Beautiful beyond expectations!

reviews.name: Roselle S
reviews.title: Happy Birthday to Me
reviews.comment: I had desired to see Bryce Canyon after looking at it online. Hubby surprised me and my bunch with a birthday hike through the canyon. In my opinion one of the most beautiful National Parks that the U.S. has to offer.

reviews.name: Huapanguero
reviews.title: Night sky
reviews.comment: Cool park. Completely different than Zion even though they less than two hours apart. A lot colder for sure so make sure you stay warm. You can see the stars at night just like they advertise.

reviews.name: Andy5573
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon is a MUST Do !
reviews.comment:
Bryce Canyon Park is a must do. The scenery is spectacular. We are older; we walk a lot, but are not hikers. We did the rim trail for most of the distance; we used the bus system between one short segment; we found the rim trail to be fairly walkable; there are grade changes, but nothing we couldn't handle. We used the shuttle system and found it to be well managed and easy to use; we shuttled to the far end and walked back (most of the way).
Younger folks who hike would probably enjoy the more challenging trails into the canyon. There is certainly a lot to explore and the scenery is unique and beautuiful. No matter your skill level--take water with you.

reviews.name: Kasey J
reviews.title: Amazing place!!!
reviews.comment: This national park was absolutely my favorite part of my trip. I was not expecting much, because I wasn't sure if we'd be able to hike at all since Zion was so packed, I figured Bryce would be too. ButI was completely wrong! We were able to hike and see some of the most unreal sights! Highly recommend this! We hiked the sunrise to sunset trail. It was so serene and beautiful. I could've spent hours there. The pictures do not do this place justice! We ended up hiking about 3.5 miles and it was about 2.5 hours. The canyon was stunning!

reviews.name: Scott M
reviews.title: Bryce soooo beautiful!
reviews.comment: Bryce was amazing! We heard horror stories about Zion and Arches closing or parking filling up so we were at Bryce by 7am on a Monday and there were stretches of time where we didn't see anyone in our view, it was the perfect time to go! So many cool photo ops

reviews.name: Barb W
reviews.title: Hoodoos
reviews.comment: Loved this canyon. Pictures don't do it justice. Recommend driving to Rainbow point and then work your way back. Grab the shuttle for those points where the shuttle stops.

reviews.name: lithlith
reviews.title: Beautiful Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is beautiful! It takes on different shades and colors throughout the day, so visit it in the morning, afternoon, and evening for different photos! Several hikes are available and various view points you can drive to.

reviews.name: Bellatako
reviews.title: Fabulous rock formations and colors
reviews.comment: The canyon is remarkable for its colors and rock formations. So unique. So memorable. Did two different hikes with very different views. Something for everyone!

reviews.name: Blimey2010
reviews.title: Beautiful concentration of Hoodoos
reviews.comment: This NP took my breath away because it is just unreal how the hoodoos jet up from the ground with incredible colors that look different depending on how the sun hits it. We did the Queen gardens trail going down into the hoodoos and came back up through the Navajo trail (Wallsteet). This is a bit challenging if not in a good shape, but it is well worth the hike. The total hike was about 4.5miles. Take your water, hat, and sunscreen with you. Plenty of rock squirrels and chipmunks. The amphitheater is just stunning. We visited late in the morning and parking was not an issue. The annual pass is a great way to see multiple NPs and it can be purchased from any of the NPs entry. We used ours to access 6 NPs in 2 weeks. It’s good for a year and costs $80. Entry to Bryce Canyon alone is $35 per car. We stayed in Kanab and drove 1.5hrs for a day trip to Bryce. Kanab is an easy launch pad for seeing Zion and Bryce and the city also has plenty to offer on its own.

reviews.name: Cary F
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: We parked at the shuttle stop in town and hopped on the shuttle to tour the park (free for seniors with lifetime pass). We walked along the rim of the amphitheater and were in awe at all of the giant Hoodoos. We started down one of the switchback trails but came to our senses when we looked back up the hill at the steep return, so bailed out and went back. Many young people were hiking all the way down and back up but it is extremely challenging as I watched them huffing and puffing and guzzling water after the trek. An amazing view.

reviews.name: ngsosu
reviews.title: Don’t miss it
reviews.comment: We had a great time at Bryce, highly recommend. We drove the 18 miles to the back of the park and Rainbow Point. On the way back we hit most of the pull off scenic sites and took amazing pictures - we particularly liked natural bridge. We also spent a considerable amount of time at Bryce amphitheater- the highlight of the park. We walked down Wallstreet trail and also did the easy Sunrise to Sunset trail - which clocked in at just about a mile of paved walking. In total, we spent almost 4 hours in the park which was just enough to have a good visit - we could have done much more, especially hiking, but this fit our plans and everyone had a great experience.

reviews.name: Florida Local
reviews.title: Well Done, Mother Nature!
reviews.comment:
Words and photographs will never do justice to the majestic views this park offers.
I traveled with an individual that cannot hike, and I am happy that most everything can be seen by car, or a short walk.
This was the most photogenic of the Utah parks that we visited.
Plus, it is a 24 hour park, I could only imagine these views with a full moon.
Well done, Mother Nature!

reviews.name: Karen R
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon is Amazing!
reviews.comment: We completed a road trip to 5 Utah National Parks. All of them were beautiful. Bryce was my favorite. I arrived for sunrise at Sunrise Point, then hiked down the Navajo Trail to Queen's Garden as the sun rose. I was alone on the trail for the first 45 minutes. This hike was so peaceful and gorgeous. It has to rate as one of the 5 best hikes of my life. As we traveled the rest of the Park, we continued to see such amazing views. Bryce Canyon is a must when visiting Utah!

reviews.name: MAP12
reviews.title: MOST EXCELLENT - my favorite of the 6 parks we saw this trip
reviews.comment: This is the one park I would have like to spend more time at - it was SO beautiful! I liked it even better than Arches or Grand Canyon. I would LOVE to return here.

reviews.name: lisa
reviews.title: Amazing Park!!
reviews.comment: What an amazing park! We also visited the Grand Canyon and Zion on this trip. By far, Bryce was the most organized, clean, and easy to access. Their trails are just amazing and very well marked. This is my favorite national park!

reviews.name: Audrey B
reviews.title: Beautiful, unique landscape-great hike!
reviews.comment: We started our hike at Sunset Point, then hiked Navajo, Peek a Boo, Queen's Garden, part of the Rim Trail to Sunrise Point. This was one of the most beautiful, unique landscapes I have ever seen. We loved this hike! Some of it was in sun, some in snow...it was so varied that we didn't get tired of it at all. At the end, we found a ranger who suggested we to go Bryce Point to see the best sunset. We headed that way, had time to drive to Inspiration Point first, and saw the sunset which was really gorgeous. (Note-I imagined beach sunsets and sunrises, so had this as a major priority. In reality, it's more the way the light changes on what you are looking at which makes it a "good time to go". You won't see beautiful colors in the sky so much.)

reviews.name: ReadRibbet
reviews.title: Get Up Early to Really Enjoy the Scenic Vistas
reviews.comment: So glad we finally made Bryce Canyon NP our destination. Unbelievable experience! We stayed near the park at a local motel in Panguitch. That allowed us to get an early start around 7:00 am which was a great decision. We were able to enter the park before collection booths were staffed (so we experienced the park without paying a fee.) We were traveling with our dog, so we needed to drive our car versus taking a shuttle or going on a tour. By chance, we ignored the first few vistas and headed further down the 18 mile scenic drive. (Sort of like skipping the first few rides and heading to the back rides when the amusement park opens up.) That meant that we got to all those additional scenic views with pull off areas without combatting any traffic, difficulties parking or large groups of other people. The final area at the end of that drive is a more area equipped with restrooms and tables. By the time were turned around and headed back to the entrance of the park around 9:00, the park had filled up. We tried to check out the first few vistas we skipped. That was difficult and we battled crowds at each attempt making driving, parking and viewing much more difficult. We did head out after spending about 2 hours in the park which was good enough for a first visit. And yes, the views were incredible.

reviews.name: eyesbblue
reviews.title: Absolutely Stunning
reviews.comment: This place is over the top. We did our sightseeing after 4 o'clock and before noon so avoided many of the crowds. The walks are easy for seniors and plenty challenging for younger folks. The buses run regularly. The visitor center and staff are wonderful. It's just such a stunning place. Take the 18 mile scenic drive to rainbow point too. It's all fantastic.

reviews.name: Bobine Kemen
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: A wonderful landscape to hike by foot or on horseback. Fascinating natural monument and very interesting history. I do recommend having a guide to explain the native superstitions and routes stories

reviews.name: Georgiating
reviews.title: Favorite hike and park
reviews.comment: Wonderful visit for our family! Visitors center worth a stop! Information desk very helpful! We arrived in the morning and hiked from Sunrise pt to sunset pt- highly recommend this direction!! It is almost all downhill. The very end is Wallstreet which is steep switchbacks. But, take your time and it will be no problem. Be sure to carry lots of water and take time to enjoy a snack along the way. This was my family's favorite park and favorite park. So different than Zion and the Grand Canyon. Don't miss it!!

reviews.name: Kahnster
reviews.title: Unbelievably awesome!
reviews.comment: Bryce was spectacular. The Park Service held everything together over Memorial weekend. Navajo loop hike at Sunset Pullout was extraordinary. We will definitely go back!

reviews.name: dabella2015
reviews.title: Incredible park!
reviews.comment: Oh boy we did the 8 trail that included the peekaboo. It was tiring but so glad we did it because the views were incredible and the up close view of the hoodoos😍. What an incredible park! Go early and take water and food.

reviews.name: iknowoc
reviews.title: A must when visiting Utah
reviews.comment: Breath taking views from all angles. Not as difficult to climb, so better for older folks or those less agile, in comparison to Zion.

reviews.name: karensSouthernIN
reviews.title: Beautiful, peaceful
reviews.comment: We thoroughly enjoyed a wonderful day at Bryce Canyon. We hiked the queens garden trail and Wall Street including the peekaboo loop. Wow! Incredible scenery with a large elevation change but so worth it. It kicked our butt on a hot June day. Wall Street was an incredible climb up-we finished by hiking sunset point back to our start at sunrise point. (Approximately 8 miles) We had plenty of water and packed a lunch. It took us 4.5 hrs. We also drove to Bryce point and Paria view. Ended our day at rainbow point, Yovimpa point, and hiked the bristlecone trail. We were completely exhausted but enjoyed every bit of it. Colors and the hoodoos and the scenery we’re amazing!￼ Don’t miss this park.

reviews.name: SueLovesDuke
reviews.title: Breathtaking. Nothing Short of That.
reviews.comment: I thought I'd seen it all after Haleakala in Maui, but this trumps it! It was absolutely fantastic. We THOUGH we would be hiking a few of the shorter trails, but we started out on Inspiration. The winds were blowing 30-40 mph and the path ran adjacent to "one wrong step and you die" territory. It was breathtaking, is all I can say.

reviews.name: George S
reviews.title: Great Park, probably the best in Utah.
reviews.comment: I believe that Bryce is the best and most exhilarating National Park in Utah. You literally walk amongst the beauty and geology. Also it is relatively small and could be experienced in a single day if pressed for time. Please note that the temperatures vary a lot and while we were there in late May the temperature in the morning was in the low 30s and did not get above 55 the entire day. One negative in this park was the poor signage and markings in the trailheads and on the trails in particular. We could not find the start of the trails and could get lost on the trails themselves. We were not the only ones — we ran into folks who were asking us for directions while we ourselves did not know where we were. But overall , highly, highly recommended for a visit.

reviews.name: Dreamy7174
reviews.title: Magnificent!
reviews.comment: The 2nd stop of our road trip and 2nd favorite among the Mighty 5. Totally incredible, especially the views from Sunrise and Sunset points. No words to describe except Ahh..mazing. The rock formations in their natural orange color were just mesmerizing. Just walked down a bit to the viewpoints and you can stay there for as long as you want. I would love to hike to the innermost walkable part of the canyon, unfortunately my husband wasn't in good shape for long hiking. This is absolutely worth the bucket list.

reviews.name: GabrielSanab
reviews.title: Beautiful park!
reviews.comment: It’s an amazing park that anyone can visit. Just drive up to an observation point and walk the rim if you don’t want to do any difficult hikes. This National park is for everyone! Such beautiful views.

reviews.name: babs12858
reviews.title: The Best!
reviews.comment: We went through Utah both on our way to and from Las Vegas so we could visit all of the National parks as well as a few state parks. Bryce, IMO, was the most beautiful park of them all with the beautiful hoodoo's. We toured All of Bryce and not just the amphitheater. We were there on May 1 and the northern points still has snow. The scenery was so beautiful that words cannot do it justice!

reviews.name: Erick Tseng
reviews.title: A breathtaking must-visit national park
reviews.comment:
A truly magical national park, Bryce Canyon National Park is one of my all-time faves. The towering hoodoo rock formations awash in bright splashes of brilliant, sunny colors will take your breath away.
You can certainly visit this park from the comfort of your own car. However, I would highly recommend devoting at least a full day here to hike the fantastic trails. Wall Street and Queens Garden were my two favorites. There's a wonderful loop that takes you from Sunrise Point to Sunset Point along those two trails and the Rim Trail along the canyon top.
Inspiration point is also another can't miss. Don't forget to hike the 5 to 10 minutes up from the parking lot to your right for it even more glorious vistas. The entire Canyon looks like a massive amphitheater filled with a packed audience of playful hoodoos.
The Natural Bridge is nice and worth a quick stop for a photo op. However, if you're tight on time, I don't think you need to drive past Inspiration Point.

reviews.name: Meenakshi P
reviews.title: Amazing Vista
reviews.comment: Bryce is certainly worth visiting with amazing views wonderful hikes and not overly crowded. Enjoyed the visit thoroughly

reviews.name: c22hubb
reviews.title: A Scene that Hits You
reviews.comment: Wow. Wow. Wow. This is amazing. We went here on a day trip from Zion National Park and I think I liked Bryce Canyon even more. It is so unique and nothing like I have ever seen. It immediately hits you as something amazing. This park also has a rim trail that is great for someone who isn't in great shape. The rim trail is paved and flat. This is a must see when you are in southern Utah.

reviews.name: Poodletoes
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon NP - Not to be Missed!
reviews.comment:
After the madness of Zion, we were so happy to be in Bryce. You can take you car into Bryce tho there is a shuttle ( free ) but it doesn't go very far. I know not using a car in the parks is more environmentally good but sometimes the shuttle systems just don't work very well. Bryce has an 18 mile road up to a vista point. There are various trails from here. We did the Bristlecone Pine trail. One mile RT thru spruce/fir forests to cliffs with bristlecone pines and fantastic views. There were signs of a past fire up here. Being old folks, we don't do much hiking down into canyons anymore and this was a really nice trail for us. All along this 18 mile road there are areas to pull off for views or hikes. The hoodoos are gorgeous - red stone everywhere. Early the next morning we headed to the Mossy Cave trail - not to be missed either. You have to exit the park to get to this section. It is the only place in the park where the trail is completely on the canyon floor. Instead of looking down on the hoodoos you have to look up at them. There is a waterfall, stream and yes, there actually is a little mossy cave.
Don't miss Bryce Canyon.

reviews.name: IWantToSeeTheEarth
reviews.title: Mesmerizing!
reviews.comment: The view on the different Points were astonishing, breathtaking, and so mesmerizing! I just wished that they have better restroom facilities. It’s an awesome hike experience if you’re into hiking. A good walk all around the Canyon.

reviews.name: Robert B
reviews.title: HIKE
reviews.comment: Amazing hikes! Do the Wall Street to Queen view hike from Sunset Point to Sunrise point for an incredible view of the park. Do it in that direction for an easier hike as well. All of the points are well worth the visit as well. We did the Bristlecone Loop as well and that was nice but the wind was crazy that day. Make sure you drive out to the Mossy Cave and hike to the cave and waterfall as well!

reviews.name: GreggMS
reviews.title: Our favorite National Park in Utah
reviews.comment: Many great lookout points for pictures. Unique rock formations with beautiful colors. Not as crowded as Zion but get there early in the morning to ensure a good parking space. Many nice hikes but there are many drop-offs. Not difficult but if you are acrophobic, this may be a challenge.

reviews.name: edmsem
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: This is a great vacation stop. Pretty views. Parking at the scenic overlooks can be challenging, so consider taking a shuttle if you are visiting at a busy time.

reviews.name: casiesmom
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is absolutely beautiful! It is breath taking at every stop! The canyon has great trails. Trails available for hikers of every level. If you are not a hiker the park also has beautiful overlooks. There is so much beauty! If you only have a day or two in Utah spend it at Bryce Canyon, you will not regret it.

reviews.name: TravelinBloke
reviews.title: Beautiful place
reviews.comment: Breathtaking views. The park is gigantic so give yourself plenty of time. I would recommend at least 3 days if you want to hike and see all the spots.

reviews.name: Veganinthesouth
reviews.title: Best national park in southern Utah
reviews.comment: This was my fav national park in southern Utah. Amazing hiking and amazing views everywhere. Arrive early to get parking. We parked at inspiration point and started for the day. This is the hiking we did and loved it: inspiration point to sunset to Wall Street to queen gardens to sunrise point : we then walked to sunset and refilled walked and went hiking again down two bridges to peekaboo (counter clockwise) up Bryce point back to inspiration point. Bathroom and water fill station at sunset point

reviews.name: J. Roy C
reviews.title: Wonderful NP
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon NP was a surprise after the mobbed Zion NP visit two days ago. We arrived about 10 am and found the visitor center parking full of spaces. Then we headed up the park scenic road. We had read to start at the top (S end of road) and head down (N) as the senic pull offs were on the R coming down. We parked at the top and walked the very enjoyable Bristlecone Trail. Wonderful overlooks and fantastic conifers. The trailhead is on the right of the parking lot as u face the main overlook.

reviews.name: BernieMat
reviews.title: Beautiful formations everywhere
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon has beautiful rock formations at every view point. They almost all face the east, so time of day makes a difference to the look you see. Sunrise brings the sun straight onto the vertical structures with shadows facing you. As the sun rises, the light goes deeper into the crevices . In the evening, the sun lights up the surfaces facing you. So, you could see the park 3 times with a different effect each time. Mornings will be busy with limited parking available. Take the shuttles as an option starting around 8 AM.

reviews.name: Louise Masin Sattler
reviews.title: AMAZING VISTAS! MUST SEE!
reviews.comment: There are places in this world that are worth the trip. Bryce Canyon National Park is one of them. A bit off the main road (about 100 miles sound of Rte 70 on Highway 89) - this is a must see! Hint- Start at the END of the park and work your way to the front . But first, stop at the visitor center to get a good map. Also know that the elevation is HIGH - so be careful if you are prone to sensitivity of high altitudes.

reviews.name: N0rmalee
reviews.title: Great place
reviews.comment: A wonderful park and so very different from Zion where we went yesterday yet so fascinating. It’s great too that in most viewpoints there is very close parking. And the senior national Parks pass got us in for free when the fee is $35 for a personal car!

reviews.name: James C
reviews.title: An Amazing Place in Living Color
reviews.comment: I departed Zion NP back through the North East gate to Mount Carmel Junction at daybreak. I then drove the Scenic Byway 12 through Red Canyon to Bryce Canon Scenic Drive summit. Very beautiful as the sun lit the inner canyon walls. Saw a string of ponies being driven to the corral for horse back rides. Lots to experience here. Don’t miss it.

reviews.name: Andy B
reviews.title: IT'S THE REAL BIG THUNDER MOUNTAIN!
reviews.comment:
Yes! It is! This is where Tony Baxter and other Imagineers were inspired to build the Redrock spires and such!
Be ready for lots of pics!
Oh, and- DO YOUR HOMEWORK!
These places can be hostile with the seasonal changes.
#templemastery

reviews.name: gonegirl
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment: Wonderous Place that words cannot describe. Breath taking experience. Worth the time and effort to get there

reviews.name: HelpfulAngel
reviews.title: Not to be missed - My Hiking/Driving Tips
reviews.comment:
Bryce Canyon National Park is one of the most incredible landscapes I have EVER visited in my entire life. Bryce is filled with Hoodoos - rocks that are weathered and eroded to create incredible formations. Fantastic to behold.
You can drive throughout the whole park and see some incredible and stunning views without hiking!
If you want to Hike:
Do the Navajo Loop/Queens Garden Trail. This takes you down into the canyon so you can walk among the shadow of the hoodoos. There is one with a switchback area of this trail called ‘Wall Street.” I recommend walking this section. Most people don’t know this and do the opposite. It is a 2.5 mile heavily trafficked loop trail.
Don't miss the Mossy Cave Waterfall hike. You must leave the park a tiny bit, but you get to see a waterfall and a sleeping bear cave. It is a magical beautiful hike. It is an easy 1-mile trail and you get to see a waterfall!
If you can do Bryce’s Rime Trail Hike. It is 0.5 miles to 5.5 miles one way and it is located above Bryce Canyon. It connects all the scenic overlooks from Fairyland to Bryce Point. If you do NOT want to hike, many of these viewpoints are accessible by car too! If you are looking for an accessible trail, there is a 0.5-mile section of trail between Sunrise Point and Sunset Point that is wheelchair accessible. I love the Rime Trail hike because you can choose to do as much or as little hiking as you want!

reviews.name: James C
reviews.title: Breathtaking and a USA must see visit!
reviews.comment: A must must do...what a beautiful park. Breathtaking! Almost 8,000 feet elevation here so be aware of the thin air.

reviews.name: Amber O
reviews.title: I think this Bryce my favorite of the "Mighty 5"
reviews.comment: Beautiful scenery as far as the eye could see. We visited all five southern Utah National parks plus a couple of state parks and I think Bryce was my favorite. Capitol Reef was a close second. I liked that there was desert and forest in Bryce and really enjoyed the hike down the switchbacks on Navajo Loop Trail. Unfortunately, Wall Street wasn't open yet, but I'll be back to hike that too!

reviews.name: Paul C
reviews.title: Not RV friendly.
reviews.comment: Not nice for us because the only RV parking is in town and need to take a shuttle. We just left. Not sure what more to say!

reviews.name: LLV280Z
reviews.title: Gorgeous and Different
reviews.comment: We spent a week in the Zion (National Park) area before driving to Bryce Canyon. This left us with expectations of Bryce that were not realistic. Don't get me wrong, it was gorgeous just not what we anticipated. In Zion you are usually looking up and surrounded by canyons, cliffs and rock formations. With Bryce we were always looking down on the interesting topography and unless there was time to hike down and back, you couldn't get close and personal to the fantastic structures. We did much research and read that the road in and back is 15-18 miles long. Every scenic overlook or hiking trail turns off to the west, which would be a left turn across traffic if you stopped at each one along the way in. Taking the road to the end and working our way back allowed us to turn with traffic. This was late April, the roads were crowded and parking was sparse and we cannot imagine how this will play out as summer draws near. That being said, Bryce Canyon was a fantastically magical sort of place and we are so glad to have experienced this wonder of nature!

reviews.name: MikeB1952
reviews.title: Magical Place!
reviews.comment: It's such a surprise. I took an early morning walk from the Lodge at Bryce Canyon. It was a pleasant walk through the forest. I got on the Rim Trail, AND THERE IT WAS! The Bryce Canyon Amphitheater. With no warning. Bryce Canyon is a totally unique place. It's hard to decide to take pictures of. There are so many beautiful features. We've been here before. This time we decided to only walk. Not take the drive. I'm glad we did. It felt like we got a more personal view of Bryce.

reviews.name: tjnels
reviews.title: beautiful national park.
reviews.comment: This is a wonderful place to visit! The way the park is set up makes it a very doable 1 day visit, including a gorgeous 3 mile hike.

reviews.name: Joyjosh04
reviews.title: A must visit!
reviews.comment: Although we were unable to walk through the amphitheater due to closures, we ddnt miss it. The views was gorgeous & breathtaking from the rim trails. Exotic! A wonderful creation from God. Felt so blessed to be able to see the beautiful nature shaped by water for millions of years.

reviews.name: Colleen C
reviews.title: Under rated National Park ~ Beautiful
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon was one of my favorite National Parks that we visited in the Southwest. the trails were easy and the view all exceptional. Bryce Canyon is a one way in and one way out drive. If you go all the way to the bottom. There is Rainbow Point with a high elevation of 9115ft. a simple trail Bristlecone is right at this point. At the very beginning of the drive right at the entrance they also have multiple places worth stopping at Sunrise and sunset point with a quick trial that connects them and Bryce Point that over looks the Amphitheater.

reviews.name: StanOrlo
reviews.title: Great place to visit
reviews.comment: We spent a couple of days at Bryce. The hiking and horseback riding are excellent. A GREAT place to visit - beautiful scenery.

reviews.name: G.Lee
reviews.title: Breathtaking beauty and awe inspiring scale!
reviews.comment: We drove from La Verkin in just about two hours, and spent 4 hours in the park, riding the shuttle around and taking in the beauty from Bryce Point, Sunset Point, and Sunrise Point, and hiking the Navajo Loop and Queens Garden trails, and that was the best spent 4 hours before heading back to La Verkin.

reviews.name: Greg P
reviews.title: Worth the day trip from Zion
reviews.comment:
We were spending Spring Break at Zion towards the end of March/first days of April and we’re debating whether the 2 and a half hour trip to Bryce was worth it. YES.
So cool, it was like a small Grand Canyon and one with incredible views and a fairly accessible ability to hike down into the canyon. In a few hours we walked pretty much from one end (sunrise) to the other end (sunset point) INTO the canyon. Warning, we only had sneakers and it was a little nerve racking at points.

reviews.name: The_Wanderer1992
reviews.title: Good Park
reviews.comment: My husband and I went to this national park and saw a couple of the viewpoints. Our favorite was definitely the natural bridge which was really neat. The visitor center had a 50% capacity and it took forever to stand in line, however, it does have an exhibit, restrooms and a gift shop.

reviews.name: Eli K
reviews.title: Inspirational
reviews.comment:
One of my favorite national parks. The views are beautiful. There’s a handful of hikes that one can do within the canyon.
For a easy hike you can walk from sunrise to sunset point.
You can watch sunset from sunset point or inspiration point.
Be aware of the elevation. You may experience some altitude sickness.

reviews.name: Liz S
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Traveling to the Grand Escalante Staircase you can travel from canyon to canyon. We were in the out skirts of Bryce and took a few pictures cause everywhere you look it’s beautiful! Breathtaking!

reviews.name: betty l
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring Views
reviews.comment:
Bryce is distinctive due to geological structures called hoodoos and it is one of the most beautiful national parks in Utah.The red, orange, and white colours of the rocks are quite spectacular and we were just awe struck with the magnificent views that we took a lot of pictures.
Though its is quite a drive from Salt Lake City it is a Must Visit Place in Utah.

reviews.name: 381kt
reviews.title: Great park but surrounding area is rough
reviews.comment: Just wanted to warn everyone that this beautiful park does not have many grocery or restaurant options nearby. We had to suffer some brutal meals. Plan ahead! Pack lunches and avoid anything by Ruby's Inn!

reviews.name: william m
reviews.title: Great over all had a lot of fun
reviews.comment: Our driver was awesome he made the trip fun ! I would most definitely do another tour with him as my driver!!!

reviews.name: Jason Homey
reviews.title: Amazing views and great hikes
reviews.comment:
My family visited in March on our tour of all five national parks in Utah. Bryce did not disappoint. We arrived around noon and were able to do a variety of hikes and viewing around the park over 7 hours. We could probably have done the park in two days but we were fine with one.
I highly recommend going to the back of the parks 18 mile road and working your way towards the front. By the end of the day, we barely had any traffic but at noon when we arrived, the front parking lots were full.
Our favorite hike was the Navajo/Queens loop. You really get to see the amazing hoodoos up close. The hike has some elevation and steep switchbacks, but it’s so worth it. There are also a lot of lookout points while driving, take advantage of them all.

reviews.name: Miriam C
reviews.title: Stunning red canyon
reviews.comment: You've got to go to Bryce for a day if you're in the area. It should be on your bucket list. The stunning red rock formations against the blue skies are incredible! We walked the canyon amphitheater and went to all the viewpoints in one day. You've got to do it. You'll never see red rock formations look so beautiful!

reviews.name: Kelley B
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: After visiting Gand Canyon and Zion National Park we drove up to Bryce. The weather was 20 degrees colder and stronger winds. Upon arrival we drove to Natural Bridge lookout and then up to Rainbow Point. The cold and wind kept both visits short. We then hiked Navajo and Queen’s Garden trail. It took about 3 hours to do the entire trail. Amazing hike and very different from Zion and Grand Canyon. Most restaurants around Bryce are closed. We ate at Pizza Place in Tropic and Ruby’s Inn for a breakfast buffet. Many websites and Yelp are not accurate in their hours of operation.

reviews.name: MMG07
reviews.title: Stunning!!
reviews.comment: What an amazing place!! We hiked the Navajo Loop and the Queen’s Garden trails and they were both spectacular. Start at sunset point if you want to go down Wall Street; otherwise if you start at sunrise point you will have to go up Wall Street, which may be too steep for some people. They are 2 short hikes but the scenery is absolutely stunning!

reviews.name: Amy R
reviews.title: Do not pass this up
reviews.comment: What beauty! This National Park has always been one of my favorites, the views are stunning. I do suggest going to the top first and make your stops on the way down. Right now the shuttles were not running so you were able to drive your own car, we did not have any issues finding parking but I’m sure that will be changing shortly. A lot of people miss out on the Mossy Cave hike. It’s a easy 1 mile round trip and you will see some amazing scenery. It is considered part of Bryce Canyon but it is about 5 minutes away from the main park.

reviews.name: Rentzm1
reviews.title: Breathtaking memories
reviews.comment:
Wow! Bryce Canyon National Park is stunning! As you drive towards it you get a tiny tease as the landscape begins to change. But nothing can tip the moment you step onto the first viewing spot. It is breathtaking...almost a spiritual experience.
The visitor center is right after entering the park. Worth a stop to get the Rangers’ insight on what to see and do. “Icy trails” update altered my visit a bit. I drove to the opposite end of the park, Rainbow Point, and then stopped at viewing points on the way back. I even set up a tailgate picnic for lunch - best PB&J I’ve ever had.
Make it a point to hike to the top of Inspiration Point. It is the best view and photo op, in my opinion.
(Flat KeeKee is a character from the children’s book “KeeKee’s Big Adventures” and is joining me for this adventure)

reviews.name: Rochelle F
reviews.title: Incredible national park - a must visit
reviews.comment:
What an amazing national park! After doing the scenic drive and stopping at sites and looking out and down, we spent the next day hiking into Bryce Canyon and experiencing it from a different viewpoint. What incredible scenery. It is spectacular and worth visiting.
Based on a fellow traveller's tip, we hiked Navajo trail and then went to Queen's Garden. So down and then up and since Queen's Garden is less "vertically upward" while still challenging, it did give us more of a chance to really focus on the hoodoos and mountains as we wound our way upward. Bring walking sticks - they help.
This park is a must see. We lucked out as the November day was gorgeous, sunny and warm.

reviews.name: Fantasmaniac
reviews.title: Still Our Favorite National Park
reviews.comment: We came for a quick weekend getaway to see the park in the winter. There was a storm that came through the first day we were there. This has always been our favorite of the five Utah National Parks, and I think our pictures explain why!

reviews.name: jennlovesfood
reviews.title: Absolutely STUNNING National Park - A NO Miss!
reviews.comment:
My friend and I spent part of the day at Bryce on our drive to Park City and I am so, so glad we stopped to see this. We had visited the Grand Canyon the day before, which was spectacular, but I really think I loved Bryce even more.
We drove to the very end of the loop without stopping and then stopped at all the stops on the way back. When we went it was not crowded at all and parking was not a problem (sometimes it is but apparently, not during a pandemic). People were wearing masks, for the most part but I wasn't worried because everything was outdoors.
Bryce is one of the most unique places. I enjoyed the Grand Canyon but it is very GRAND. Bryce felt smaller and more intimate. Even though we didn't go down in to the canyon, I felt like I was more a part of it then at the Grand Canyon. Such BEAUTIFUL scenery - everywhere you look is a picture.
I can't recommend this National Park highly enough - so beautiful and so thankful it has been preserved so beautifully.

reviews.name: motherchristmas61
reviews.title: Gorgeous, a must!
reviews.comment:
We drove from Capitol Reef National Park to Bryce. Gorgeous drive and we stopped at Kodachrome State Park, and then to Stone Canyon Inn in Tropic, just before Bryce Canyon. We wanted to stay in their tree house but they only have two and they were full. We got a cabin that was awesome. They also have a fantastic restaurant on site, beautiful view and fantastic food...make reservations.
We got up early to view the sunrise at Bryce Canyon at Sunset Point and it was breathtaking. Take a tripod and watch the magic happen. Wear layers, walking stick, good walking shoes, hat, sunscreen, water and camera. The hike amongst the hoodoos is fantastic, take your time, stop and rest, enjoy your surroundings and keep hydrated. After our hike we went out through the park entrance and ate breakfast, then we stopped at the park information center and signed up for a night sky ranger talk for later that night.
We went back into the park and stopped at different look outs. We ate dinner at our lodge and went back for night sky viewing and talk about stars and planets. We did faintly see the Milky Way. We also went back to the hoodoos at night and took photos. It was my first try at night sky photography with an iPhone. They were a bit blurry but you can get some great photos at night! Try it.
Visually stimulating park. Definitely recommend seeing this once in your lifetime.

reviews.name: Texas_Travel_1
reviews.title: Rock Formations, Rock Formations and geology.
reviews.comment: You have to like rocks and geology to enjoy this park. I find this park a disappointment. You need good hiking boots, some special equipment, and ability to hike at high altitude. You can also drive to the furthers south point and just view the cliff overhands. There is a lack of things to enjoy, unless you like rocks.

reviews.name: tonypusa
reviews.title: Beautiful in winter
reviews.comment: The snow interleaving the hoodoo structures made for a picturesque scenery. The hike from Navajo trail to the Queen's garden was an easy 2 hrs if you do it slowly to catch your breath at high altitude. We took far too many photos, which speaks volumes to how unique the landscape is.

reviews.name: Joseph D
reviews.title: Great park
reviews.comment: Definitely worth doing less time consuming than zion but different views. Have proper boots and water/snacks. Come sooner in the day if possible for avoiding crowding and parking issues. Many spots to pull off and view nice landscape. Highly suggest going all the way to the highest point which is the end of the main road. Check out the arch while there. Would skip the old tree trail.

reviews.name: jordd21
reviews.title: Must do National Park!
reviews.comment: Beautiful views! They had just gotten a lot of snow so some of the hikes were closed and some of the walks were snowy/icy. We did Inspiration point, Bryce point, Sunset point, and Sunrise. Inspiration point parking was icy and a few people got stuck trying to get in. We had a 4 wheel drive care so we didn’t have any problems. Just to see the views is worth the $35 fee. You receipt is good for 7 days so if you are planning on spending a few days hiking it’s extremely worth the cost. The visitors center is really nice and the park staff is super helpful. They are very knowledgeable and can help with any of your trail questions. I definitely recommend hiking boots and chains in the snow. We had on sneakers and they didn’t have enough traction. Overall amazing! Can’t wait to go back in the spring so we can hike.

reviews.name: TinkaS16
reviews.title: Beautiful Park with breathtaking virws
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is stunning. We visited in July during a small National Parks road trip. We went in the late afternoon so we could enjoy driving through the park, visit the numerous observation points, enjoy the sunset and take in the darkest skies for stargazing. I really don’t have enough words to describe how serene this park is. If you are visiting other parks in Utah such as Arches or Zion, make sure you carve some time out to spend time here’s

reviews.name: Steamboat323
reviews.title: Surreal Delight!
reviews.comment:
This was our favorite NP in Utah, for several reasons: Less crowded, really unique scenery, and fun moderate hikes. Tip: arrive at sunrise for amazing photos. We loved hiking down into the canyon on the Navajo Loop and Queens Garden Trail from Sunset Point all the way back up to Sunrise Point. Every corner we turned, was surreal.
Late November was a great time to visit - a dusting of snow made sunrise incredible!

reviews.name: tom g
reviews.title: A little water did all this
reviews.comment: Wow is the only word to describe this place. Of all the canyon sites we visited in Utah Colorado Arizona and Texas, Bryce is the most impressive. The formations are absolutely beautiful.

reviews.name: Ruben C
reviews.title: Amazing National Park
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is until now my favorite National Park, the views wherever you stand on the park are just amazing. The hikes are awesome and whenever you look at you will find it completely stunning. If you have the opportunity to visit, do it. You wont regret it at all.

reviews.name: ianschneller
reviews.title: Go! Easy day trip from Zion
