reviews.comment: About two hours from Zion, this is a great day trip. Bryce is gorgeous and you should plan on a full day here to get in a good hike and see the different observation points. If you do travel from Zion note the tunnel closing times to ensure you don't have to take the long way back. We hiked the Queen's garden trail which was a blast.

reviews.name: bobber84mn
reviews.title: Unbelievable!
reviews.comment: We couldn’t get enough of this Park. We drove the 18 miles into Rainbow Point and worked our way back to the entrance. We thought 18 miles wouldn’t take long to cover. Each stop was more beautiful than the next. We spent hours here and could have spent much more time!! Wonderful views of nature at its best!

reviews.name: Natasha A
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery and dark skies for stargazing
reviews.comment: Very beautiful scenery able to be accessed via a scenic drive which would be good for wheelchairs. If you are up for the challenge you should definitely hike the hoodoos in the amphitheater via the navajo trail/ queens garden. Absolutely beautiful! If your able to do a hike straight uphill the last 0.6 mile do it clockwise. If not would probably be easier counter clockwise. Also stick around at night to see more stars than you have ever seen in your life!

reviews.name: sheldon g
reviews.title: Don't skip Bryce Canyon National Park when visiting Zion National Park.
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon National Park is great for people who can't walk very well. The drive through road, with scenic overlooks was terrific. We took tons of pictures from the car since every turn in the road produced even more beautiful scenery. Bryce may be over shadowed by Zion National Park, but it shouldn't be. It has different types of rock formations and is more than worth a drive through. Don't skip this park.

reviews.name: Ken Q
reviews.title: Most Scenic National Park!
reviews.comment: This is the most scenic of the national parks that I've visited. The hoodoos were beautiful and fascinating. Definitely worth a couple of days to hike the various trails and enjoy.

reviews.name: Colleen C
reviews.title: Smaller, but so worth it!
reviews.comment: Though one of the smallest parks, this was definitely worth the stop. We drove from the entrance all the way to the far end (which made the stops on the way out much easier since they are all on the right side of the road as you drive back towards the entrance). Every stop had a really nice parking area with spectacular views of the canyons, the natural arch/bridge, the spires, etc. It was amazing to us that we originally anticipated every stop being similar, and yet we were so wrong; every stop offered something completely different! This was a true gem, and we enjoyed it even more than we expected.

reviews.name: Questovia
reviews.title: Snowed Out
reviews.comment: Unfortunately the timeframe we had to do Bryce ended up being low visibility days due to the snow. Having always wanted to see this park, I still want to see it! We did drive around a lot but had no distance views. Spent a lot of time at the visitors center looking at the maps and wall exhibits of the park.

reviews.name: Tamara S
reviews.title: A Breathtaking Place
reviews.comment: We loved our recent visit to Byce Canyon National Park. Even though we are a disabled older couple, there was plenty of beauty to see. My husband, who has knee problems was able to get to most of the sites. The ones that required a little more of a hike, I did alone. Most of the main areas of the park are accessible by car. We had a lovely time!

reviews.name: radx4
reviews.title: Awesome National Park
reviews.comment:
Sitting at the top of the Grand Staircase in southern Utah is Bryce Canyon National Park. Although not one of the most popular parks, Bryce is full of unique rock structures and formations. There is no other place like this anywhere on Earth. The hoodoo rocks are interesting and formed through a erosion process that is not present anywhere else. In late October crowds were very reasonable with ample parking everywhere we visited.
There are several hikes that you can do in Bryce Canyon National Park. Navajo Loop and queens Garden trails are the most popular, and they're great to do. If you don't like to hike, you can drive around and stop at various you points to see the rock formations. In all honesty, the views are actually best from on top before you hike down into the canyon.
Either way, Bryce Canyon National Park is one of the national parks that you simply must visit.

reviews.name: patn03
reviews.title: One of the top sites of the whole trip
reviews.comment:
Pretty much everything about our visit to Bryce was amazing, although we were there late in the season and a lot of the amenities were already closed or reduced. The scenery is obviously amazing - beautiful, and there is so much variety throughout the park and all its hikes. Definitely do the Quee's Garden/Navajo loop hike - it's a bit challenging but certainly worth it. I'd recommend going through Wall Street on that hike in the afternoon, as it lights up beautifully with the afternoon sun. (Also I'd go UP the Navajo Loop side - I think some of the steep bits would feel slippery coming down but going up they are just steep and require The occasional break.) The scenic drive was all right, but if you have limited time I'd skip most of it and spend most of your time between Sunrise Point and Sunset Point, as there is so much beauty and so many hikes there. The paved trail from the campground to Sunset Point is a decent length for walking dogs if you bring yours, and you can see some great views from it.
The campgrounds are clean and spaced out, although it's difficult to visit since they are all reservation-less during late fall and it can be hit or miss whether you will find a site even getting there early. The rangers at the sites gave very helpful talks and tips, although the ones at the campground seemed a little overzealous. I understand that they have a tough job, but the day we were there they drove around every 20-30 minutes all morning and afternoon, staring down people sitting outside and not waving back or ever saying hello. While it wasn't bad, it had the effect of making me feel like a kid in school again, wondering if I was breaking a rule I didn't know about.

reviews.name: Michelle L
reviews.title: Magical
reviews.comment: One of my favorite National Parks. It is so unique, where desert meets forest, it was simply breathtaking.

reviews.name: Lisamb1
reviews.title: Beautifully different and a must see
reviews.comment: We visited in early October during the Covid pandemic. We visited at sunset, then the next day sunrise and we hiked. I think sunrise was the best but sunset also beautiful. I would highly recommend parking near SUNSET point (not sunrise) for the sunrise and you can hike down a little to the Thor’s Hammer to get a nice opportunity. We saw sunrise from that area but moved around a little. Then, we hiked down the Navajo trail going down Wall Street and the switchbacks and then to the queens trail to sunrise point. Glad we did it that way. Many people went the opposite direction. But, I heard that this was a good direction to take.

reviews.name: AndanteNoCal
reviews.title: Great hike on Peekaboo Loop
reviews.comment: We went to Bryce a few years ago, September of 2016 (a date not available to select on this website) but would love to return soon. Our favorite hike was the Peekaboo Loop, down around the amphitheater. The hoodoos and windows were just magical. It didn't take long to get away from the crowds. We took our time and enjoyed every minute. Ok, I have to admit climbing back out wasn't easy, but what views!

reviews.name: atlas993
reviews.title: So different than any landscape we’ve ever seen
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon was very cool. It was surreal landscape you would never see anywhere else. We only went to Sunrise and Sunset points (we parked at the lodge and walked to them) and did the Queen’s Garden hike. The hike does have some very steep sections at the beginning, but other than that it wasn’t too difficult. We had a 3 year old (we had a leash attached to his arm just in case because there were major drop-offs) and an 8 year old and they handled it just fine. In the time of COVID I will say there were definitely sections of this hike that were narrow and we were there in the afternoon so there were lots of people, so we were glad we had our masks. We also did the quick Mossy Cave hike, which leads to a waterfall. The water was very cold, but the kids loved it. Again, lots of people so social distancing was not easy. If you’re in the area we’d recommend devoting at least a half day to see Bryce Canyon, it was definitely worth the time.

reviews.name: cathigreen
reviews.title: Delight and awe around every corner
reviews.comment:
We came to Utah during Covid for a healthy outdoor adventure ahead of a long winter looming. Our first stop was staying at Ruby’s to hike Bryce Canyon. This was my husbands first hikey vacation so we started out easy.
We followed the trail to the left for the Navajo Loop. Folks of all ages were managing just fine from papoose carrying dads to little kids to near seniors like ourselves.
Coming through the Wall Street was breath taking and just awww bit challenging. The key is to rest and drink plenty of water.
Next we drove to the end of the park and stopped at every vista along the way. Each view was better and majestic. We took a short windy hike at the end and headed back to base for a swim. Fantastic day!

reviews.name: Jim A
reviews.title: The Hidden Gem
reviews.comment:
Bryce doesn't get the attention of some of the other great National parks, but it deserves every bit of it. Simply fantastic!
Take the 18 mile park road and stop at several of the sights along the way. They all look different and they are special in there own way. The great arch is a personal favorite.
Then walk some or one of the trails. The Navajo loop is the best, but its not for the faint at heart and is an extremely difficult climb back to the top.
Bryce is now one of my favorites and we will be back!

reviews.name: Lovtorun
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment:
Amazing views. We spent several days and hiked into the canyon on several trails. Favorites were Fairyland which we started at sunset point, Peekaboo from Bryce Point, Queens Garden and Navajo Loop. We also walked the rim from Sunrise Point to Inspiration Point. Such different perspectives of the hoodoos.
Really enjoyed staying at a cabin at the lodge steps from the rim.

reviews.name: Melanie C
reviews.title: Natures Beauty at it's best.
reviews.comment:
Breath taking scenery. A photographers dream .
Have your camera ready to capture all the beauty.
Scenes change with the time of day also, morning and
sunset. Both beautiful.

reviews.name: condorchristi
reviews.title: Your Eye Sees It...Your Mind Doesn't Quite Believe It.
reviews.comment:
The park is one of the special places on earth.
The landscapes is other-worldly. Hoo-Doos (pronounced Who-DOOZ) are in the canyons. You can hike down into them if you like. But you would lose the incredible overview. The views go on forever through the canyon. Trees that would dwarf you house are somehow reduced to shrub size by these rock formations.
Outside of the canyon, the grounds are wooded and well kept. This park is made for cars but somehow is not over-run. You can walk 50 feet or less from your car and see all of the items I posted on this review. If you wish, the well made paths will lead into the canyon too.

reviews.name: naturetack
reviews.title: Hoodoos everywhere
reviews.comment: Wasn't sure what to expect, but that first view over the rim looking down at hundreds of hoodoos is one you'll never forget! Loved taking the hikes down and around, and making the drive through the park to all the different scenic points. You can definitely see the whole park in a day, and pick and choose your stops for an unforgettable experience.

reviews.name: HoffySig73
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: OMG this is the most beautiful park i have ever seen. Fantastic to see. Much of the hike trail is closed in spring, Go after april :)

reviews.name: denise b
reviews.title: It will blow your mind
reviews.comment: The size and variety of shapes and colors will soon teach you that you can't walk and gawk at the same time. One of our favorite places

reviews.name: Mike W
reviews.title: Amazing Hoodoos, too many massless people
reviews.comment:
The park is amazing and worth visiting weather you just drive to the view spots or hike down to the amphitheater.
It is high altitude and the best view spots require a bit of walking, often uphill. So be prepared to catch your breath both getting to the views and then again when you see them.

reviews.name: Rae H
reviews.title: Magnificent park
reviews.comment: We hiked the garden queen and Navajo trail. My 5 year old cried and whined for the first half and then took off for the 2nd half. We finished at the Wall Street end and I’m so glad we did it because it was a spectacular end to the hike. Do not hesitate to hike this trail.

reviews.name: Paul K
reviews.title: Bryce is the best of the UT national parks
reviews.comment: Our favorite of the Big 5 Utah national parks. Lots of room for lots of people and the views were varied and other-worldly. Lots of hiking and biking to do as well as a magnificent main road with overlooks galore. This should be on your list of to dos! We spent 3 days here, staying at a vrbo in nearby Tropic.

reviews.name: Cheryl Lyn
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Amazing and such wonders as you hike through this canyon! The hoodoos are all unique and beautiful. Bring plenty of water and snacks and enjoy the many beautiful sites. Take a moment along your hike to stop and look around!

reviews.name: waynefromcali
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon National Park is Amazing!
reviews.comment:
After the snow in Bryce! Bryce Canyon National Park located in scenic Utah, is an endless collection of geologic wonder!
Bryce Canyon is a series of natural amphitheaters or bowls, carved into the edge of a high plateau. The most famous of these is the Bryce Amphitheater, which is filled with irregularly eroded spires of rocks called hoodoos.

reviews.name: Judit
reviews.title: Beauty
reviews.comment: Beautiful nature created canyons. Like the signs to the viewing points. Sunset and Sunrise points were my favorites.

reviews.name: CofCMom
reviews.title: Hoodoos!
reviews.comment: This is an amazing and unique Nat'l park. There were many hiking options and shuttle service. We chose to drive through the park. It is recommended to drive to the furthest lookout and then pull off at the observations areas on the way back to the beginning because all of the pull-offs are on the right. This worked well for us. The hoodoos are wild and unbelievable. We were there in the early morning and the light at that time was great for photography.

reviews.name: Alex H
reviews.title: Excellent views
reviews.comment:
I drove in from Zion and the views here are wonderfully different. I parked at the shuttle station in town and bought the individual pass ($20) and rode into the park. The park is in a couple different parts the Bryce Amphitheater (The shuttle only runs here inside the park to BrycePoint) and then the South Portion (Only accessible by car.)
The trails are nice, I just hiked the rim and rode the shuttle Bryce, Inspiration, Sunset, Sunrise and Bryce Lodge. Views were amazing for only have less than a full day. I spent 5 hrs just on the main points but could easily spend a full day if I was by car. I loved it overall!

reviews.name: FRANCESCA B
reviews.title: Oh, Bryce!
reviews.comment:
The more I roadtrip around America, the more I think that Utah and Arizona are the most gorgeous and unforgettable places where I would go back over and over again and never get tired.
Love love love Bryce!

reviews.name: LOz08
reviews.title: One of our Country's Great Wonders
reviews.comment: Hiking Fairyland Loop Trail was my favorite part of visiting the Canyon. It is about an 8 mile loop and is moderately difficult but entirely worthwhile. We also enjoyed all of the lookout points and hikes in the Amphitheater but they tended to be more crowded. The geology and sheer beauty is breathtaking.

reviews.name: JRSears
reviews.title: A sight you won't soon forget. Another World.
reviews.comment: On our tour of Utah's Big 5 parks. Bryce was a wonder to see. Bryce was crowded and we start early knowing the parks are busy right now. We parked at the Sunset point lot. Hiked down Wall Street, better down than up I believe. Then up to Two Bridges, backdown Queens Garden. Finished up Queens garden to Sunrise point. Then along the rid walk back to the car. Good hike take some water. We drove to Inspiration point. It Lived up to its name. It's the must see view point while visiting. We ended our day at Bryce Point. This day was filled with vista's from another world it seemed to me. A wonder to see all in one day enjoy.

reviews.name: mlt673
reviews.title: Freedom to explore this park
reviews.comment: As compared to Zion, BC wins due to the freedom offered to explore so many areas of the park. We loved that we could go everywhere that we wanted. Hike down, up, and around. Zion is so controlled with what you can and can’t do and how to do it (hence required shuttles) but here you just go do it. It’s beautiful!

reviews.name: JDwalke
reviews.title: Breath taking
reviews.comment: We decided to drive to Bryce Canyon from Zion. It’s a beautiful 2 hour drive! We spent about an hour in the park driving to the 5 main lookouts and then drove back! Definitely worth a day drive to see it!!

reviews.name: mikechris2
reviews.title: Canyon tours
reviews.comment: The views are breathtaking recommend sunrise and sunset trails for morning and evening. They’re easy trails to hike if your looking for more of a challenge there are several trails that take you into canyon.

reviews.name: rankin2010
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Words and pictures cannot define the majesty of this canyon. You just have to see it to appreciate it.

reviews.name: Hot_Dog1590456
reviews.title: Fantastic Park
reviews.comment: Fantastic park. This is the second time we have been here and it doesn't get old. Really some nice trails and the park is set up well for driving and for hiking.

reviews.name: Vicker32
reviews.title: Never gets old
reviews.comment: Wonderful National Park, staff are doing a great job at adapting with ever - changing COVID-19 restrictions. Plenty to do for kids, especially the Junior Ranger program and Hike the Hoodoos challenge. Nice, quiet campground (Sunset) with tons of shade.

reviews.name: FRED W
reviews.title: BREATH TAKING
reviews.comment: Was the 2nd time I've visited, first was 23 years ago. Seeing all the natural beauty of all the view points and vistas was amazing. Also the the hike to Mossy Cave.

reviews.name: Saffron
reviews.title: Another gorgeous National Park!
reviews.comment: We started off with a fantastic two-hour horseback riding trip to the floor of the Canyon with Canyon Trail Rides . We called the night before and were able to get a morning ride in. Very exhilarating at the beginning of this ride as you go down a very steep trail with no guard rail! So glad we did this as it gave us an up-front look at places we might not have seen. Then we took our car and rode around, stopping off here and there for a short hike or an overlook. But really nothing compared to what we saw on that horseback ride!

reviews.name: jrdc2017
reviews.title: Do. NOT. Miss.
reviews.comment:
Stunning landscapes and great hiking options for all skill levels. First do the scenic drive to get a feel for everything the park has by pulling off and taking in the views at the various spots like Sunrise and Sunset points and the amphitheater. This park like the others (except Zion) is very user friendly for driving and the map provided gives you plenty of hiking options graded at easy, moderate, and strenuous along with distance.
If you have time, hike below the rim among the hoodos on trails like Queens Garden/Navajo loop and the Peekaboo trail, it feels like a different planet. Go early for everything as the park and the trails are wildly popular. More than any of the other parks, its hard to take photos that capture Bryce. You can get portions of it, but you just can't stop marveling at the landscape and how it changes as you hike.

reviews.name: SpfldForestGump
reviews.title: Spectacular park
reviews.comment: I’m ready to go back! This park is beautiful and so accessible to hike. We spent a little over two hours on our hike. Much of the time was looking up and across at the view. So many pictures trying to capture the moment. We started at Sunset point, walked down Wall Street, through the Navajo loop, Queens garden and back up at sunrise point. It was incredible. Could have spent one more day and taken another hike. Take plenty of water

reviews.name: JamieHtravels
reviews.title: You Must Visit This Park!!
reviews.comment: This place is so worth the trip and pictures just don't do it justice. Walking into the amphitheater is breathtaking and the trails that take you amongst the hoodoos are beyond beautiful. I felt there were trails for all ages, I hiked with my 65 year old mother and found many places I could take her that didn't wear her out. If you're not a hiker you can drive throughout the park and stop at all of the beautiful viewpoints. This park has something for everyone. We went two days in a row at various times to see how the sunlight changed the colors and in the evening we saw many Mule Deer which was also fun. There was even a food cart at one of the stops and their menu included vegetarian items (bonus for me.) The gift shop has a nice variety of items for sale. This is a wonderful place!!

reviews.name: HeidelbergSummer
reviews.title: Bucket List
reviews.comment:
Checked one more national park off the list, but this is now rated #1on my favorite parks. We hiked the Queens Garden around to Wall Street. Breathtaking . Don't forget your camera...or two. Also carry water. I was amazed at how many people who did not have water.
Not to be missed

reviews.name: blphx
reviews.title: Beautiful country!
reviews.comment:
The views were amazing! Wish I was a hiker! The formation varied from.each pull out!
The tip to go to the furthest view point worked well then all stops were on the right!
The food truck was a nice option.

reviews.name: Paul H
reviews.title: Absolutely a must see on you bucket list!!
reviews.comment: One will be totally amaze of God’s workmanship! Two days usually covers most of the highlights. You are basically on a mountain ridge overlooking a deep canyons. Spectacular views. Diffidently visit Mossey Cave trail just outside of the park and on the way to Tropic. The lower trail was a hoot.

reviews.name: David S
reviews.title: Plan on at least two days if you can, bring lots of water! and just breathe it all in!
reviews.comment:
Absolutely breathtaking in more ways than one! The sights are unbelievable everywhere you turn. Be careful hiking unless you are acclimated to the higher altitude.
Service from the rangers was just great. Very helpful and kind. The visitor's center is quite nice with lots of helpers and a nice selection of travel treats.
Plan on at least two days to get as much in as possible. We did a few trails in just one day and wish we had more time to explore.
We did try and stay awake for the star gazing and made it till 9:30pm. I was happy to see more stars than I have ever seen, although for the full show I suspect one needs to be awake at midnight or 1am.
However as we were leaving, we saw a herd of deer grazing in one pasture and on the opposite side of the road the buck keeping watch. That was a magnificent moment, as I have seen deer before but never a herd or group! Wonderful!
Nonetheless, this quick trip was well worth every minute and a nice respite from being locked down in our home state.
We knew coming in the views and sights would be beautiful. What we did not know was just how amazing and well, simply wonderful they would be.

reviews.name: Josh
reviews.title: Nothing like it
reviews.comment: We went to bryce and hike from sunrise point to sunset point. We have traveled all over and never seen scenery like this before. Such an amazing view. The hike was from one side of the rim, hike down and across, then back up to the other point. Not the hardest hike, but the way back up will make you pretty winded. Its only like a 3 mile hike so its not too bad. I'd say its worth it to go for just the views alone.

reviews.name: frogcarguy
reviews.title: What an Amazing place
reviews.comment: I had heard about it. I had seen pictures. But until you see it in person—you have no idea. To beat the crowds, we arrived at 0830 on a Sunday. We had the place to ourselves. What you read advises you to go to the far point and stop at points on the way back, as they are all on the right side of the road—which is what we did. Not sure I agree with that. By the time we arrived at sunrise/sunset/inspiration points, the most popular points,about 1100, it was very crowded. Had I it to do over, I would stop at these places first, before the crowds. Another note, if you’re into photography, morning isn’t the best time, as at most points you’re facing east and many views are in shadow. Great pictures are going to be in the afternoon.

reviews.name: LandedInRoundRock
reviews.title: breathtaking, beautiful.
reviews.comment: Great hikes, beautiful color, tremendous vistas. Town has all basic services needed, all owned by Ruby's. Decent prices, considering we are captive audience. night sky program in park is an added bonus.

reviews.name: The Adventure Buddies
reviews.title: The Adventure Buddies goes to Bruce Canyon
reviews.comment: The Adventure Buddies had a great time seeing the sights of Bryce Canyon particularly inspiration point and Mossy Cave were our favorites for the kids and photo ops. As beautiful as everything else is, it’s more of the same. You could spend a couple days doing all the hikes or like us 3 hours using the shuttle system inside the park that drops you off to all the popular spots. Mossy cave you have to drive to, small waterfall nice streams good for kids.

reviews.name: zipty22
reviews.title: Unforgettable National Park
reviews.comment: Beautiful National Park. I would say you need two days exploring and hiking around this park. Outside of the park there are areas that are close to drive to that are nice as well like Escalante National Park and red Canyon.

reviews.name: Julie W
reviews.title: A magical experience!
reviews.comment: This was a silver lining of COVID. I was able to book into the park lodge easily and got to be in a cabin. The Cabin was steps from Sunrise Point, and in my opinion one of the most beautiful parts of the park. There are many trails to take and many pull outs. We used Just Ahead, a national parks app, and it directed us where to go and what we would see, if there were trails it would say how long, how far and if it was strenuous. We had only one day here and I could have stayed a few more easily had I known what I know now. Though I didnt rise at Sunrise I did get magical pictures just an hour or so later. With COVID the crowds were thin and we were able to really enjoy the park.

reviews.name: MeuterMedia
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: By now you should know... this is the most impressive National Park in the big old Usa. Now in 2020 is the time to visit. highly recommended MeuterMedia

reviews.name: diangeltravel
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Great view, pretty hard hike to the bottom of the canyon, especially coming back up. It is all worth it though, it only takes about 16-30 minutes with stops to make it.

reviews.name: Cheryll D
reviews.title: God, the Creator has Shown His Splendor
reviews.comment: To view the magnificence of God's creation is an awe-inspiring adventure. We totally loved Bryce Canyon National Park. It makes for a great family vacation!

reviews.name: ldenker
reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.comment: Bryce is one of the most beautiful parks I have ever seen. We drove the scenic route first, walked a couple of tough trails and visited the view points on the way down. I used the Gypsy App for the tour. Amazing day

reviews.name: twinskin
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: I had been wanting to see Bryce Canyon for a long time and I planned on driving there however I found a deal on an excursion. Bryce Canyon is one of the most beautiful places on planet Earth. While the temperatures are colder than I had anticipated it was incredible to see the beauty of the park.

reviews.name: jand637
reviews.title: Stunning beauty
reviews.comment: The hoodoos are really stunning. This is a great place to take photos and to hike. We combined the Queen’s Court Trail descent with the Navajo Trail ascent for a 3 mile hike. The descent was a little scary for me because of the sharp, steep drop offs at many points on the trail, sometimes on both sides. However, it was not difficult to stay safe, you just need to be aware. Its not a place where you can walk along while staring at your phone screen. Most of the trails lead down to the canyon floor where you wind through the rock formations before you have to ascend back to the top. There is no way to avoid an ascent. The trail we took stayed mostly along the canyon floor until the very end. The ascent consisted of a series of at least a dozen or more short switchbacks which were very steep. We ended our hike just before noon. It was a beautiful day, not all that hot, we are both in good shape and we found the ascent extremely strenuous since all of the elevation gain was packed in at the very end. We still enjoyed the hike and the park is amazing. I have hiked through other hoodoo formations before, but the sheer enormity and concentration of formations here is something that must be experienced. A photo cannot do it justice.

reviews.name: Paese
reviews.title: Scenic Drive
reviews.comment: A quick weekend getaway. It was fun driving through Dixie Forest as well on the way.Our fave spots were at the beginning and the end. Not as long of a scenic drive compared to others, but grateful they had it open during covid. Distancing and sanitary rules were set in place. Hopefully the next time we come, we can walk the trails! Other than that, we got a lot of great shots of the canyon.

reviews.name: MajorLSU
reviews.title: Great National Park
reviews.comment: We visited the park and they are handling the crowds very well. National Parks seemed to over crowded for after Labor Day and the staff is very accommodating at this park. The shuttle bus is highly recommended as parking is an issue with this many people wanting to get out.

reviews.name: Ralph S
reviews.title: Most Wonderful!!!
reviews.comment: All of the lookout points were most inspiring and breath taking... Plan on spending the day. The Lodge restaurant was a great place to stop for lunch. Bryce is one of our most favorite places to visit (20 degrees cooler than Zion's). Truly one of the wonders of the world to see.

reviews.name: flosventure
reviews.title: Great Views!
reviews.comment: Bryce is a very cool place and situated in southern Utah, where you can find so many more cool things! I went for a day and visited all viewpoints. The bad thing was that all the smoke from the California wild fires filled the canyon with haze so it was all a bit nasty. My favorite viewpoint was Sunset Point and Inspiration Point, super cool places! I also recommend hiking down to Thor's Hammer and Wall Street when you're at Sunset Point. Sunrise and Sunset Point where both busy in the morning (Labor Day) and I couldn't find parking so I went to the very end and worked my way backwards. I would recommend though that before you go, make this more a hiking experience than a I go to viewpoint and look into the canyon experience. I'm not a hiker and just wanted to see stuff and I got the impression that the majority of people came for the hikes and actually hiked. Only doing Wall Street and Thor's Hammer, I really have to say, check out all the hikes and go on several because I personally felt that Bryce is, say compared to Grand Canyon, more of a hiking park than view point park!

reviews.name: Kaye N
reviews.title: A Wonderland of Color and Shapes
reviews.comment:
Of the five national parks in Utah, Bryce is my favorite park. It's other worldly, stunning, awe-inspiring, magical. It's weird and wonderful! It's a very easy park to visit and you can make it whatever you want. If you want to just get out of your car and see the sites from the viewpoints, that's great and you'll see amazing scenery. If you want to hike and explore, there are many trails that take you down into wonderlands or across the rim. We especially like Yovimpa Point, the area in the southern part of the park. The Bristlecone Pine trail is fairly easy and not very long but gives you time in the forest.
We've enjoyed camping at Bryce before but this time we stayed at Ruby's Inn - a wonderful choice right outside the park.
Watch for deer and squirrels and several kinds of birds. Look off into the distance to see mountains far away. Study the colors of the rock, various shades of orange and some with white tops. Go out and look at the night sky! You'll see thousands more stars than if you try in a city.
The view areas had social distancing reminders that were fun - see the pictures!

reviews.name: FeetinDaSand
reviews.title: Magical! Put this on your Bucket List
reviews.comment: What a fantastic and magical place. Started by walking the rim and overlooking the amphitheater. The hike takes so long because you have to stop and look and take a picture around every band. Then the hike down into the Hoodoos is mystical and magical. Great for any age. I saw Kids from 8 to 80. The elevation is over 7000 feet so it is cooler even in the summertime. We did have to share one of the trails with some horse groups but mostly they are limited to their own trails.

reviews.name: mgs1627
reviews.title: My Favorite Park
reviews.comment: This was one of my favorite national parks. You can easily walk around on the rim. There are points that will offer great sunrise or sunset pictures. Heading down into the canyon is a must if you can. We did the Navajo/Queen's Garden Combination Loop Trail. We started it by Sunrise Point and headed down into the canyon. The trail has uneven surfaces but once you get to the bottom it is pretty easy. They categorize this trail as moderate. Had we started at Sunset Point I would say it is moderate because we would be going down through the endless switchbacks. We chose to go up the switchback which was strenuous. We bring hiking poles to help us when we hike. They can help stabilize you as you hike. I loved Bryce and would go back to see the trails and overlooks we didn't get to see or hike.

reviews.name: JohnnyOxnard
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: We thought that Bryce was the most picturesque part of our trip touring through the national parks in Utah. Our favorite place was sunset trail. Was a good hike down and with all the switchbacks, not to bad coming back up. From top to bottom the colors and shapes are breathtaking.

reviews.name: Bill K
reviews.title: Great Park
reviews.comment: One of the very best national parks. Great vistas, numerous exceptional viewing points and trails, beautiful sunrise and sunset viewing opportunities, and one of the best parks for stargazing.

reviews.name: Ron
reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.comment: This park has the best views of any NP we visited, better than Grand Canyon or YNP. Plenty of trails with various degree of difficulty. Plenty of parking at main trailheads.

reviews.name: writealready
reviews.title: Incredible Views. Best Stars. Great hikes.
reviews.comment: Right now, especially during Covid, Bryce is a much better choice than Zion. It is perfect for all ages. Little ones can do short level hikes and still look out on the mind-blowing hoodoos and other rock formations in the canyon. Older ones will enjoy the hike down into the canyon itself. Plus, if you are camping or just want to stay after dark, Bryce definitely has the best views of the stars anywhere around. If you travel out to the end of the park's road, you will be surrounded on three sides by vast canyons, very dark, where the stars come down to the horizon, which is below you. Magnificent!

reviews.name: Patrick C
reviews.title: Stunning....
reviews.comment: Another area you should see, we hit a lot of places in the same trip—Grand Canyon, horseshoe bend etc etc. we took the drive thru the park for about 2-3 hours. The scenery is amazing and will not disappoint. You should see this in your lifetime at least once if not multiple times to remind you that nature is amazing....

reviews.name: LaurieTEX
reviews.title: Amazing hike
reviews.comment: Definitely worth the effort, steep inclines at both ends of the Queens Garden/Navajo hike. Take your time and enjoy God’s handiwork.

reviews.name: Joe N
reviews.title: The Hoodoos!
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon National Park will take your breath away. The park is absolutely stunning with something to do for people of all ages. Pack a lunch and start your hike in the morning for a full day to explore the trails. I want to come back here as there is so much to see and so much beauty to take in. Oh, and not to mention you will get to see the Hoodoos which is an extremely rare rock formation if you're in to that type of thing.

reviews.name: erkle
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon is not crowded!
reviews.comment: Visit Bryce Canyon now. No reservation is required, the park was not crowded, and all overlooks had space to pull out. The only problem was the lack of picnic tables. I guess the park service removed 90% of them due to Covid 19, so don't plan on a picnic with a scenic view. BATHROOM TIP: there was a line to get into the visitor's center. If you only need to go to the bathroom, skip the visitors center. Just a few minutes down the road there are plenty of bathrooms at Sunrise Point, the lodge, and Sunset Point with no wait.

reviews.name: Christina C
reviews.title: Fav National Park
reviews.comment: Bryce is my favorite National Park thus far. It was absolutely incredible and, honestly, underrated - I personally liked it even more than Zion! We did the hike through the Navajo Trail starting at Sunrise Point and ending at Sunset Point, where we then walked back to the Sunrise parking lot along the paved path. Totally blew us away. It definitely wasn’t easy with the inclines/stairs but totally worth it!!

reviews.name: Kswany
reviews.title: Hoodoos!
reviews.comment: This is a worth addition to Utah's Five National Parks. The hoodoo's in the morning light are spectacular. It is easy to drive into and find parking as well. We didn't have time to hike into the canyon but could see paths and people on them. If we would have had more time, I would have gone and done those hikes as well. Well worth a visit.

reviews.name: love2travelIndy
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I did the wall street trail. What goes down must come up lol. Such an easy walk going down with breath taking views. Not much wind down inside on the trail with lots of sun. take plenty of water. Great narrow paths in the red rocks with cool tunnels in the rock. Then take it slow and pace yourself for the trip going up.

reviews.name: Monica C
reviews.title: Deserves the trip
reviews.comment: Amazing view in such a spectacular and unique place that deserves the trip. We loved Sunset point, sunrise point, inspiration point. I suggest to go near sunset time to enjoy the rocks wonderful colors.

reviews.name: Bandit331
reviews.title: "Beautiful America!"
reviews.comment: Wonderful National Park, great visitor's center & numerous hikes from easy to challenging. Less crowded when we arrived and plenty of parking, inside the park or outside (can shuttle in). Campgrounds and lodge available with grocery store. Splendid views of hoodoos and nature!

reviews.name: Evamarie P
reviews.title: Things to do in one day
reviews.comment: I traveled with my husband and 19-year old son. We started our day at 8 am and went to the Shuttle Stop across from Ruby’s Inn. We purchased a park pass which gave us access to the free shuttle to take us through Bryce National Park. We stopped first at the Visitor Center and immediately went to the Information Tent outside. I signed us up for the Night Ranger Talk held at the North Amphitheater at 9pm. They only allow 40 people during COVID so you must sign up the same day and early. Then we hopped back on the shuttle and went to Bryce Point. This was one of the most beautiful views I have ever seen. You can see the entire amphitheater from this view point. We took the advice from the shuttle driver and hiked the Rim Trail from Bryce Point to Inspiration Point about a 1.5 mile hike. If you are afraid of heights do not go. I was at first but then was so glad I went. It was a moderate hike and I would not take young children. Some parts are very narrow and the edge is very close. We hiked to Inspiration Point and hopped back on the shuttle back to the Shuttle Stop where we started. My son then rented a mountain bike for $25 for half a day and rode an 8 mile trail to Red Rock Canyon. I picked him up at the Tunnel. Then we rested back in our room. We went for dinner at The Pizza Place in Tropic and on our way back we stopped at Mossy Cave hike. It is very easy about half a mile and there is a small waterfall that you can walk behind. This was a great stop and highlight of our trip. Then we went back to room and rested and left for our night program at 8:30. The outdoor amphitheater has benches and a movie screen. The ranger spoke about animals seen at the canyon. One is the best parts was you could see a million stars in the sky just from sitting in the amphitheater. The ranger talk lasted 40 minutes and we were done for the day at 10 pm. Awesome day!

reviews.name: Phoenix Flyer
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon NP hates RVs
reviews.comment:
Bryce Canyon is a visual marvel.
If you’ve seen the Grand Canyon then this should be next on your list.
I wish I could have given it 5 stars but the park isn’t too RV friendly.
I visited the park with my wife and our dog in our 29 foot class C motor home.
The problem is RVs longer than 20 feet are NOT allowed to park anywhere near the most important “must see” viewing areas. RVs of that length are either required to park at the visitor center overflow; which would then require about a 3 mile round trip walk to the sights. Or someone is required to circle the area in the RV while the rest of the party goes to see the hoodoos.
On top of that dogs are only allowed on hardened surface pathways which is tough on their feet.
So if you’re planning a trip to Bryce Canyon NP. Leave your dogs at home and park outside the park and use the shuttle.

reviews.name: Richard S
reviews.title: Stunning Beauty
reviews.comment: Words cannot express what beauty you will find here. So many places to drive and see the vastness of this park from many points. As far as an 18 mile drive in the park to Rainbow Point. You must take your time and enjoy the park. Many trails some are easy and some are more difficult.

reviews.name: Tamara H
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring
reviews.comment:
We chose to use the shuttle system and got off at the Bryce Point stop. We were told the mile and a half hike to Inspiration Point along the rim was relatively easy and had great views, so we decided to do that. We had a backpack full of Ice and Gatorade, sunscreen, and baseball caps, so we felt prepared for the 90+ degree journey. We took our time and meandered along, stopping whenever we wanted pictures or to enjoy a bit of the shade. Our home is at sea level, so we are not used to the elevation at all, and that was obvious anytime there was a bit of an elevation gain along our trail.
One of the best things was that even though we were there on a Sunday and it was crowded at the visitor center when we arrived, we only saw two other couples on our entire trek along that part of the rim. We felt like we were completely alone, which was very peaceful.
There was no problem getting on the shuttle when it was time to move on. We chose to stop at Sunset Point and see the views from there, and while beautiful, not comparable to what we had already seen. The shuttle wasn’t running to Rainbow Point, and we felt like we had seen enough, so decided to call it a day. I’m sure we missed out on some amazing views, but we were happy with how we spent our time at Bryce Canyon.

reviews.name: Ybailon
reviews.title: Fun trip
reviews.comment: Although we are having a great pandemic. I decided we should go explore the great outdoors it was nice people respected social distancing. We did the Rim Trail it was amazing 😉 highly recommended I went with my 11 year old granddaughter it was perfect 👌 a must see for everyone.

reviews.name: Diego1954
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon Heavenly Trails
reviews.comment:
Because of the Pandemic, I drove from California to Denver to visit my son and his wife. On the way back I spent a day at Bryce Canyon National Park. I had seen so many photos I was worried that nothing could really be so dramatic, I was wrong, photos don't do it justice! The expansive landscape of salmon colored Hodoo towers and Fin ridges is other worldly and the park is much larger in person.
The views from the overlooks are breathtaking, but the best experience is to take one or all of the trails down into the valley and back up through the sculptural stone towers. The trails are well designed, wide enough in many areas for 4 people across, they narrow down to go through towering ravines or stone openings. I also found the grades to be gradual and comfortable. But be prepared to climb up hill, the trip elevations changes range from 200 to 1500 feet. I was told the Navajo Trail/Queens Garden loop that I took had a 480 foot elevation change.
For me one day was not enough, I'd recommend at least two to give you time to explore north and south park trails. I guarantee you'll enjoy it!

reviews.name: DawgExplorer
reviews.title: Trip highlight
reviews.comment: We visited 6 national parks, 1 national monument, and 2 state parks on our family trip and the family all agreed that Zion and Bryce were easily tied for #1. The hiking down into the canyon was magnificent and a great experience no matter the age. I encourage people to bring their young kids here to experience God's amazing wonders to introduce those unforgettable moments in nature. Our 4 and 6 year olds loved every moment outside of the car ride to ge there however it was totally worth it. Just do it.

reviews.name: Kip F
reviews.title: Lots of trails, lots of tourists
reviews.comment: We did all the trails in one area of the park, where it is very popular, so we had to go early. The photo opps were great, and the trails were nicely maintained. So many gorgeous view points.

reviews.name: Carl E
reviews.title: Plenty of hiking on Fairyland trail
reviews.comment: You can drive to the look out points or you can hike through the canyon. It is always better to get out in the parks and hike them. We choose to hike the Fairyland trail which is about 8 miles. It doesn’t have as many hoodoos but there are a lot less people on that side of the canyon. You do need to take plenty of water. We ended up being a water bottle short. The fairyland trail is easier going counterclockwise but you do have to climb up to the top twice on the way out.

reviews.name: Lizeth R
reviews.title: Totally Worth the Drive
reviews.comment:
After 4 days at Zion and back to back hiking, we decided to make the (2 hour @ 8am) drive out to Bryce Canyon.... dreamy and breathless views! Super magical!
We went up inspiration point for the perfect views and then did the Navajo loop trail...so much fun! It’s about a 1.2 mile loop. It’s much easier if you start the loop to the right (towards Wall Street) than the other way around. We didn’t have much time but would have loved to continue the trail into peek a boo or queens garden (all connect). A lot of shade around the trails but take water and expected to be dirty. Definitely take hiking shoes as rocks can be a bit slippery if you’re adventurous and like to climb.

reviews.name: Gretchen M
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful!!
reviews.comment: This canyon is by far one of my favorites. The views are awesome. Drive the scenic road to the end and then stop at all the lookout points on the way back. Hike some of the trails too. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: ALH
reviews.title: Hiker’s dream!
reviews.comment: There really are just no adequate words to describe the majesty of this place, so I won’t try. What I will say is that the park is very well managed. It’s pristine with beautiful, thoughtfully-planned trails for hikers of all levels. We spent the better part of a full day here, just taking in the sweepingly-dramatic views with colors we have rarely seen in nature. We opted to hike; but bikers, horseback riders, and ATV enthusiasts will find it’s easy to book many tours of differing lengths and degrees of difficulty. We are passing through on our way to Yellowstone and only planned a couple of days at Bryce, but we will be back in the future to stay at least a week!

reviews.name: IfAndyCantHelpYou
reviews.title: Pencil sharpener
reviews.comment: As a child I had a friend named Bryce and came here looking for him but the canyon was to big and I didn’t find him, if you find Bryce tell him that Bryan from 3rd grade needs his pencil sharpener back, thanks

reviews.name: lostsmoothie
reviews.title: Simply Stunning
reviews.comment:
Visited on a Sunday at the end of July. The park was not too crazy busy. The views around Sunrise Point and Sunset Point are the BEST! We also did the Queen's Garden, Navajo Loop, and portion leading to Wall Street trails. Simply stunning. I had read in previous reviews that the best lighting is in the early morning/around noon - and this was very true. As it got later in the day, the lighting was not as good for photos. If you are going on any of the hikes, be sure to wear hiking boots or tennis shoes with enough tread on them, as the trails can be steep and slippery without proper footwear. Also, bringing enough water is a must - at the higher elevation, you get tired more easily and the trails do not have a ton of shade - you will definitely need proper hydration! After we did the hikes, we drove the 18 miles down to the end of the park to Rainbow point, and then stopped at the scenic pull-outs on the way back. The drive and turn-out spots were beautiful, but the most impressive part of the park is the main Bryce amphitheater by Sunrise and Sunset Points. If you have a limited amount of time in the park, I would recommend skipping the drive and focusing on the hikes/viewpoints around the main amphitheater. The visitor center did have a nice gift shop - but if you're looking for snacks/drinks, those are located at the park general store. We did see several deer, as well, so be on the lookout for wildlife.
Overall, Bryce Canyon exceeded my expectations (definitely up there with the Grand Canyon in terms of amazing scenery!). We had been at Cedar Breaks National Monument just before getting to Bryce Canyon, and Bryce Canyon is definitely more amazing (but totally worth stopping there as well, if time permits). If in the area it is a must see/do! Definitely doable in 1 day or 1/2 a day!

reviews.name: Kim L
reviews.title: Take plenty of photos
reviews.comment: This is the second time I've been to this park & there still was not enough time to see all there is in this park. Don't forget to check out Fairyland outlook which is located before you enter the park. If you're not a hiker you can still get spectacular photos from any of the outlooks. Beautiful!! There's also many opportunities to observe wildlife at certain times of the day.

reviews.name: Ashley G
reviews.title: Wonderful, majestic!
reviews.comment: Pictures will never do it justice... this place is spectacular! Something for everyone- from easy to challenging! We did the 3 hour horse ride with Canyon Trails (awesome!) and felt it was the best way to see a majority of the Canyon. After we did the Navajo loop and it was so rewarding!

reviews.name: Carlos T
reviews.title: Beautiful Views
reviews.comment: This is the first time visiting this Bryce National Park and the overall experience was excellent! Awesome views throughout the park! The temperatures vary from one part of the park to the other! Plenty of beautiful views! Worth the visit!

reviews.name: jeck
reviews.title: COVID and Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment:
Just visited Bryce Canyon this week. Attendance is way down. The overflow lot at the visitor center was empty and the main lot was only around one quarter full. The visitor is doing a good job of social distancing. There are indications on the floors regarding where to stand. In addition, many of the services such as maps, souvenirs, and help from the park rangers are also available outside.
We hiked two trails in addition to the rim walk. The Mossy Cave trail outside of the park was crowded, but for the most part, people were wearing masks. People on the Peekaboo trail were considerate and moved to the side or pulled up their masks, especially if we pulled ours up. It was crowded going back up to the rim and it was hard to avoid people due to the narrow path.

reviews.name: Billy M
reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.comment: This place was awesome. Lots of great views and pictures. Highly recommend this place. As soon as i get the thousands of pictures I took sorted out ill post in comments.

reviews.name: Heather
reviews.title: AMAZING
reviews.comment: There are no words - this place is amazing. The views are phenomenal. There were many different levels of hiking available.

reviews.name: Stephanie M
reviews.title: Beautiful Sceneries
reviews.comment: In Bryce Canyon you stay in your car and drive for each scenic vista to another. There are a few vistas where you can get out and take short hikes. The biggest hike is below the rim. There is a shuttle that takes you to a few of the vistas.

reviews.name: Don Norrenberns
reviews.title: Wow - God is creative!!
reviews.comment: What an amazing display of God's creative genius!!! We spent a full day exploring this treasure. The views are simply amazing. Driving to take advantage of multiple viewing sights was well worth it. Excellent trails.

reviews.name: BFDStein
reviews.title: Among our favorites
reviews.comment: (Visit during Covid-19) We’ve been to over a dozen National Parks and Bryce is by far our favorite. Excellent for kids (ours ages 6 and 8). Cool enough weather to make hiking a breeze, which isn’t common out west in the summer. There are several hikes about a mile long, and many for longer. Safe, well maintained, remote, quiet. Main shuttle bus views get busy in the afternoon but it didn’t deter us, even during the pandemic. Most people on the trails were masked. We will go again and again. Camp nearby - the weather is amazing!

reviews.name: 4stevemandy
reviews.title: Beautiful rock formations! We were on a bus tour and had limited time, but this was a beautiful park
reviews.comment: Beautiful rock formations! We were on a bus tour and had limited time, but this was a beautiful park! We hope to return and spend more time!

reviews.name: Susannah W
reviews.title: So impressed with this park!
reviews.comment: The roads were well marked, as were the maps. The scenic drive was great, and we enjoyed all the overlooks and stops you could choose to do along the way. It seemed like each overlook gave you a different perspective of the canyon, which was really incredible. Highly recommend this park to those traveling in Utah!

reviews.name: RoadCaptainRoss
reviews.title: I think this could be my favorite national park
reviews.comment: My husband and I decided to do a motorcycle vacation out to Bryce Canyon while we were social distancing during the Covid-19 pandemic. OMG it was fantastic! We drove past inspiration point and went clear to the end of the park which is about 18 miles long. Pulled off for one beautiful sight after another- including a group of about a dozen antelope. Our last stop was inspiration point. I am so glad we saved it until last - spectacular!

reviews.name: gottalovepink
reviews.title: You Need to Visit!
reviews.comment: I decided to travel to Utah's Mighty Five and experience something new. Bryce Canyon National Park was my 2nd Utah National Park and boy did I fall in love with it. I was able to enjoy the views from top as well as do some hiking through Queens Garden Navajo Loop along with Wall Street trail. I couldn't stop looking at the hoodoos. They were incredible. I wished I had been able to spend more time but this just means I'll have to be back.

reviews.name: Rocket_Man0691
reviews.title: Accessible Trails
reviews.comment: Lots of great trails in the moderate category easily accessible form North end of park from multiple locations

reviews.name: Scott wisc
reviews.title: Beautiful park
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful park with many trails and several different overlooks.would definitely recommend.

reviews.name: CactusCamper74
reviews.title: Totally worth it!
reviews.comment: We took the shuttle from the Visitor's Center (park across the street for long-term parking) to Sunrise point, hiked the Queen's Garden Trail and the Navajo Loop Trail and ended up at Sunset point. SO glad we took the shuttle, as parking was limited. It's a canyon, so enjoy the hike down and prepare for the long hike back up. But totally worth it! The rangers were very helpful and on the shuttle we were given facts and history about the park. Be prepared to wear a mask, and prepare for lines at the shuttle after 11am.

reviews.name: Kelli S
reviews.title: A must see!!!!!
reviews.comment: Of all of the National Parks in Utah this is my new favorite. So much to do on a two day visit. Many hiking options but also many scenic views to enjoy if hiking isn't your thing. The food options aren't great in Bryce City and are pricey so bring food with you if possible.

reviews.name: C-Z-1982
reviews.title: A true national gem
reviews.comment: So many trails, so much to see, short trails, long ones. Beat to watch the time of day if you want to hike. During the summer hikes are best done early in the morning or at the end of the day when the temperatures are reasonable.

reviews.name: Piper417
reviews.title: Gods gift to us
reviews.comment: Wish I was younger to enjoy hiking around this, but driving through and stopping at the overlooks was beautiful, so young or old, go out and see this wonderful gift that God left for us to enjoy.

reviews.name: Ulli
reviews.title: Stunning views
reviews.comment:
Highly recommend visiting Bryce Canyon NP! The views are absolutely stunning and around every corner there is something new to explore. We took our self prepared dinner to the sunset point and watched an amazing sunset. The next day we spent 3 hours horseback riding through the entire canyon (sooo worth it for horse lovers!!!)
I would come back to Bryce Canyon immediately!

reviews.name: The Places Where We Go Podcast
reviews.title: Epic hikes and geological formations here
reviews.comment:
Another great National Park. There are unique geological formations here that are simply spectacular. There are numerous hiking opportunities within the park. We chose the Fairyland Loop one day (a good 5 hours and a serious workout), as well as the complete Navajo Loop Trail which is a must do experience while in Bryce.
The Visitor Center is recommended as a first stop for getting situated, obtaining recommendations for hikes that fit your level of fitness, as well as learning about any closures or things that may impact your stay at the time of your visit.
This is a place that affords ample opportunities for the photographer. Starting with the hoodoos, you’ll also see foliage up close, as well as wonderful panoramic vistas that stretch far and wide.
A great treasure with well-maintained hiking trails. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: 5inavan
reviews.title: Everywhere you look, is amazing. June 25, 2020
reviews.comment: We drove from Green River, passing through Capitol Reefs National Park in about four and a half hours, stopping for a picnic brunch. We spent from noon to 3:30 in the park driving to all the points and getting eyeful of views. We ate our sandwich lunch at Paria View then worked our way out to Yovimpa point. We swung into Inspiration Point and Sunset Point just before leaving, and were still in awe. It was hot with a great breeze that kept us in check. There was a park ranger talking to a small group at Yovimpa Point and everyone kept their distance. From here we drove through Zion to LaVerkin for two nights.

reviews.name: JaneD
reviews.title: Fantastic views!
reviews.comment: We had the best time in Bryce Canyon! There is so much to see and do. I would recommend visiting the park for at least 2-3 days. You will not regret putting this National Park on your bucket list.

reviews.name: Byron Ellen Shaw
reviews.title: Totally blown away
reviews.comment: The pictures speak for themselves. The hikes are just as they are described. If it says easy it is. You can walk down into the canyon and be engulfed by the hoodoos! Totally awesome! I gasped a lot at the site that amazed my eyes.

reviews.name: mnguru1
reviews.title: Wonderful. I'd definitely go back.
reviews.comment: Breathtaking. Hoodoos are very cool. Beautiful park. We did the Sunset to Sunset point, with the Queen's garden in between. A one of a kind experience. Unlike anything I've seen. Imagine going to Mars.

reviews.name: orlandotourist
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon: Another Natural Wonder In The Southwest
reviews.comment:
We arrived at Bryce Canyon National Park on our tour of National Parks of the Southwest.
We arrived at Bryce Canyon National Park and planned what we do for the afternoon that we were there. Since we only had a few hours at the park, we went over the different trails available that run along the canyon. The heat of 100+ degrees in July and the elevation at 8100 ft. had some impact on our choice of trail to do.
There is a shuttle system within the park to get to various locations without having to drive and park. There is a guide for the various hiking routes with their distance, time, and level of difficulty to help one decide what trail to use.
We chose a 1.5 mile hike along the Rim Trail overlooking the canyon starting at Bryce Point and ending at Sunset Point. It was relatively flat, and even with the heat and altitude, it was an east walk to get several perspectives of the Canyon.
The highlight of Bryce Canyon are the so called “hoodoo” formations that are pinnacle like structures eroded from the sandstone. We were able to see such features as Thors Hammer and Wall Street, as well as some of the trails down below in the canyon that would have been interesting has we more time at the park.
Following our hike, we ate at a quick serve eatery next to The Lodge and Restaurant and had a little time for souvenirs at the large gift/souvenir shop.
It was a beautiful, cloudless sky, and ideal for our short visit to view this picturesque canyon and its interesting rock formations.

reviews.name: Dave S
reviews.title: Great / Must stop
reviews.comment: Just amazing place, the canyon is indescribably beautiful. This place has a lot to offer as far as views without having to hike.

reviews.name: sleepy155
reviews.title: Amazing formations and views
reviews.comment: Be sure to have a few days so that you can see all this great NP has to offer. Hike as many of the loop trails that you can. They all have something different to offer. My suggestion is to do all of the hiking first on one day. Day 2 go see a sunrise at sunrise point. Then drive all the the way to the end of the road without stopping. Do the bristle cone loop trail there, and then start the drive back to the entrance stopping at the view points on the way back. 2 full days was enough for us but some people may choose to spend more. Don't miss this beautiful NP.

reviews.name: Laura L
reviews.title: Amazing day!
reviews.comment:
We Started our day hiking fairyland loop, and 8 mile loop that get you down into the hoodoos and is not as busy as the shorter trails. Next we drove the 18 mile Road to the very end and checked out the highest elevation lookout point in the park.
**Don’t bother stopping on the way there as you can catch all of the pull-offs RETURNING as they’re on the right hand side looking down into the canyons!
Visitor center looked cool, but was a mostly closed due to Covid. Stayed the day...make sure you stay to see Sunset Point late in the day as it’s beautiful. And maybe see a jay, prairie dog or antelope, like we did :)

reviews.name: HoopUte
reviews.title: My favorite Utah NP
reviews.comment: We visited not too long after the park reopened after COVID shutdowns. That was nice because crowds were down a lot. BCNP usually gets over 3 million visitors per year so in peak season parking is a problem. Not this time. Had wonderful walks along the Bristlecone Loop and Rim Trails as well as a horse ride along the Peek-a-boo Loop. Nothing looks like BCNP. The natural beauty is breathtaking.

reviews.name: 50stateswithtwins
reviews.title: Views are breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Amazing, out of this world gorgeous views! Layer your clothes as temperature fluctuates greatly depending on the time of day and where you are in the canyon. If you want a stamp in your national parks passport hit the visitor center early otherwise the wait can be long due to restrictions on the number of people permitted at one time. If it’s bathrooms and souvenirs you want, the lodge in town has an amazing selection. We hiked the 1.3 mile Navajo loop and LOVED it! It was definitely worth getting into the canyon. Wear hiking shoes, bring water and snacks and plan to take it slow due to the incline. I’d suggest going down towards Two Bridges first so you can come up the more gradual switchbacks through Wall Street. Beautiful, breathtaking views. So glad we visited! No lines to get in and parking was not an issue at any of the pullouts in the early part of June since reopening after Covid-19 shutdown.

reviews.name: shauna g
reviews.title: No Lyft or Uber these guys to the rescue
reviews.comment:
Rescued Transportation and information from near Tropic on hwy 12.
We had car problems and were stranded on hwy 12. There is no Uber or Lyft in this area A family of 5 plus dogs needed a ride to the hotel once the tow truck came. I left a message on their answering machine asking about transportation help but they could not contact me due to limited cell service Mabry, shuttle driver came out and found us and took us to the hotel He gave info for mechanics and future towing Options for personal shuttle to other cities as needed Small town we help each other

reviews.name: SkyLineGR
reviews.title: Unbelievable.
reviews.comment: Of all of the Utah parks. Go here. We stayed at Ruby’s RV. It was good. Good WiFi and right outside the gates of the park.

reviews.name: Glenn F
reviews.title: Beautiful! Loved the experience.
reviews.comment: The first day we drove to the furthest viewpoint and drove out stopping at each viewpoint. The second day, we entered the park at 7:30 am and we were able to enjoy Inspiration Point and Sunrise Point with few other people. Almost alone. There are also some short , great scenic hikes - Queen's Garden and Navajo Loop.

reviews.name: leroys73
reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: We stayed near by. We took the on/off tour bus. This beat driving the park which we did one day. I cannot describe it in words. Go you will know what I mean. Of course I very much enjoy the SE part of Utah.

reviews.name: Mark
reviews.title: MOST AWESOME SCENERY I'VE EVER SEEN IS AT BRYCE CANYON
reviews.comment: I visited Bryce Canyon about a dozen years ago and vowed to return. On my second more recent trip there, my wife and I again hiked into the canyon and did the Navaho Trial though Wall Street and then came up the Queens Garden Trail on our return. It took us a very leisurely 2 1/2 hours. Being in our mid to upper 60's and considering the elevation of over 8,000 feet, I would advise avoiding a hike during the heat of the day. My wife is in excellent shape but being on a beta blocker, she had difficulty ascending the hike back up. For most people in reasonable shape this is a very manageable hike. I got up before sunrise both of our mornings and Sunset Point is spectacular at sunrise. The two trails we hiked feature spectacular scenery of the famous rock formations called hoodoos. Peekaboo Loop looks even more awesome but is a much more demanding and lengthier hike. As there are limited options in and around Bryce, I would highly recommend staying at the Bryce Lodge for convenience and value. But you have to book the property way in advance to get the dates you want. I think an arrival in the afternoon followed by one full day and one more morning is the perfect amount of time if you want to hike into the canyon. (2 nights) We went in mid to late September which was perfect. I'm guessing late May to mid June would be equally good timing as the nights can get cold even in May and September. We've been to all of the national parks in Utah and Arizona. Bryce is the gem of them all. Hiking below and along the hoodoos watching them change colors is simply awesome and unforgettable.

reviews.name: ELKW
reviews.title: beautiful and unique scenery
reviews.comment: Bryce canyon national park is not very big, you can see most of the view points and drive along the scenic drive within a day, if you want to hike some trails, then may take 1 more day, you can see the hoodoos in a panoramic view in viewpoints, but you want to see them in a closer look, it's better to walk a trail, the Queen's garden/Navajo combination loop is a good choice, it's not too harsh compared to other trails, and you can finish it in 2-3 hours. The hoodoos formation here is quite unique, not common in other national park, I think the scenery here is even better than those in Grand canyon, much better than in Zion, of course they are different styles, you will see different geology in different parks, but this is certainly the one you don't want to miss it.

reviews.name: di v
reviews.title: Awesome Park
reviews.comment: We went to the 5 National Parks in Utah and this was def my favorite. The hoodoos are so cool to see, there is a beautiful scenic drive with viewpoints to stop at on the drive. There are also several points to park and walk to. Also be sure to drive the Zion to Mt Carmel highway- a 1 mile drive through the mountain in a tunnel with windows cut out.

reviews.name: Jennifer B
reviews.title: Beautiful in snow
reviews.comment: We just happened to be here when it snowed! Even though much of the park was closed between the snow and corona virus — it was beautiful to see the hoodoos in contrast with snow. Park service plows road and main visitor areas, we had no issues.

reviews.name: julie6114
reviews.title: Absolute Beauty
reviews.comment: A total must!!! Can’t say enough about this spectacular park. We went mid March, dress in layers but be prepared to start shedding them as you hike if your going in the cooler months. It started out at 39 degrees but jumped to the mid 50’s during the hike. Also be prepared, plenty of water, snacks and good hiking shoes. We encountered snow on the trails which was expected in March but just come prepared. Views were incredible, each turn on a trail had us saying the views just keep getting better and better. Restrooms available and gift shop and small restaurant at one of the buildings. We did Peek-A-Boo trail which was 3 miles but total hike to get to Peek-A-Boo was about 6.85.

reviews.name: Kat M
reviews.title: One of the highlights of our trip!
reviews.comment: We did the Mighty Five (Zion, Bryce, Capitol Reef, Canyonlands, Arches) in a week. I was so glad we hadn't skipped this one. We fit it into a full day and felt like we got most of what we wanted in. Rode horses through the hoodoos, hiked several trails. Personally, I liked this one better than Arches, but that seems to be an unpopular opinion. Spectacular views at every stop on the drive through the park. Waking up early for sunrise was WORTH IT!

reviews.name: Jane G
reviews.title: What a beautiful place!
reviews.comment: It was snowy when we were there, roads had been cleared, views were fantastic, most of the trails were closed because of the weather, but that did not stop our enjoyment of the overlooks and the amazing views.

reviews.name: Moon
reviews.title: The perfect time for the perfect beauty
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is beautiful anytime of the year. But March with some snow is adding more beauty to it.

reviews.name: Chris R
reviews.title: Enchanting
reviews.comment: We spent two and a half days in Bryce Canyon national Park. Although I couldn't hike as many trails as I would have liked because of all the the snow and ice I did get down a few and am amazed at everything I saw.

reviews.name: Libby T
reviews.title: The MOST amazing scenery ever
reviews.comment: We have visited lots of national parks, but the scenery at Bryce is amazing. Even if you aren’t able to hike much, there are some wonderful viewpoints that you can drive to. We did hike in snow, but the Visitor’s Center provided excellent advice and we were able to buy boot chains that were invaluable for hiking in the snow. We had a great time!

reviews.name: Katrien Vranken
reviews.title: Very impressive Parc!
reviews.comment: We went to Bryce on our road trip. We were all very impressed of the beauty of this Parc. It was really overwhelming. I hope 1 day I will go back

reviews.name: Robert2014
reviews.title: Wow.
reviews.comment: Don't need to say anything more. The park was spectacular. Went there and saw the sun rise. Then hiked the queens garden/navajo loop. Really cool. Then went on a park ranger led shoeshine hike to Paria Canyon. Lot of fun. Simply a great day.

reviews.name: dougd540
reviews.title: Awesome Place to Visit - Stunning Scenery
reviews.comment: We enjoyed this visit immensely. The scenery is second to none and the contrast with the snow on the ground is beautiful. Also enjoyed the fact that this is the off season and traffic is sparse. Makes the experience even better. The film at the visitors centre was informative and beautiful. Great time.

reviews.name: The Wife
reviews.title: Thought I would only see something like this on National Geographic
reviews.comment: Visited March-2017 - This park is stunning! One side of the street is trees for miles and the other side is hoodoo's galore which we found amusing. We spent a day here hiking many different trails, we found it awesome that one of the trails still had snow - and a lot of it. It was so much fun falling in the snow unexpectedly - we laughed so hard so many different times from our falls. I never thought I would see a place like this with my own eyes, it was so hard to hike with the simple fact that I just wanted to stand there and take in the beauty at every turn. We ended up skipping dinner to stay and watch the sunset and watch the stars come out, there were so many stars and you can see the milky-way which was pretty neat. If you are deciding between Zion and Bryce because you cannot do both my thoughts are this - for hiking Zion is better but from a majestic/picturesque standpoint Bryce wins!

reviews.name: tigreener
reviews.title: Crazy landscapes
reviews.comment: I love the bus system. I was dropped off at walked the 10 miles through the most unusual landscape. It took much longer walking just because I stopped to take so many pictures. Walked to the visitor center to catch the bus back to the parking area.

reviews.name: Russ Lacuata
reviews.title: Stunning Natural Playground
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon showcases the stunning geology of southern Utah, a red rock wonderland created by the wind, water, and snow. Among the most beloved and photographed parks. The park is a major draw for hiking, rock climbing, and winter cross country skiing.

reviews.name: mountains74
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Lots of beautiful country great views saw some mule deer. I really love the color contrast that you see from every view point.

reviews.name: sashkow
reviews.title: Another amazing canyon
reviews.comment:
We are spending some days to browse this area- Antelope, Zion etc
Bryce is a must see. The snow has made the area even more festive and beautiful.
The orange formations are making it quite different and unique compared to the other sites.
The sun puts pinch of light game to the picture so your eyes and your soul are so satisfied.

reviews.name: fasieh
reviews.title: Life time memorable trip
reviews.comment:
One of the best hilly terrain in US , with all scenic views . Must recommend fun lance for all weather's.
We had 16 family members from 55 to 2 years enjoyed a lot. Very safe and good roads with various activities.

reviews.name: AnaBaile
reviews.title: Amazing winter trip!
reviews.comment: Bryce views never disappoint, but winter is another level of beauty! In addition to the beautiful easy access driving through the park and stopping at overlooks, we also brought our snowshoes (although they can be rented locally...or even supplied for free if you take one of the ranger-led tours.) We snowshoed on a few of the trails, and even "off-trail" on one of the ridges overlooking the vista. Our favorite was the Bristlecone Pine trail. We hardly EVER saw another person on any of our hikes this time of year. The contrast of the brilliant blue sky with the vermillion of the sandstone features, all contrasted with pristine white snow was spectacular. Then add in the green of the ancient bristlecone pines, ahhhhhhhhhhhhh. Another event we attended was the telescope presentation (once a week during winter, more often during peak seasons). It was worth the night time trip back into the park as we viewed the Orion Nebula, Venus, distant galaxies and more. My favorite part of that experience was having the staff point out and name various constellations, which I do not have the imagination to pick out myself. This winter visit was a long-time wish and we are glad we went. FYI the overlooks on the main road are very accessible for any ability (and many who are disabled.)

reviews.name: Tony Z
reviews.title: Very special
reviews.comment:
Very special place! White snow made it even more picturesque.
Very slick and metal chains on your shoes to add traction would be best.

reviews.name: Axell33
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: What can you say, its amazing. If you have only a short time to visit there are lot of great view points to enjoy but if you have the time, go hiking into the canyons its simply amazing place to see. Either way you wont be disappointed its just simply an amazing landscape.

reviews.name: Amber M
reviews.title: Beautiful Place!
reviews.comment: We visited Bryce Canyon National Park while in Utah on our honeymoon. The park is beautiful and the hoodoos are fascinating!

reviews.name: bkestep
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment:
I love the Grand Canyon. I do.
