But I must say that Bryce Canyon is stunning!! The drive, the hikes, the hoodoos, etc.
It will always remain one of my favorite destinations!

reviews.name: Alina M
reviews.title: Favorite National Park
reviews.comment: After visiting all the national parks in the intermountain west from Yellowstone down to the Grand Canyon, Bryce is my favorite. There is no where else in the natural world that compares to this feast for the eyes. I can return again and again.

reviews.name: MonTewa94
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: Loved this amazing National Park. The drive to and from Page was worth it. We asked the ranger where to hike and he suggested the loop that took us to the Queens Garden. A strenuous hike in the winter but worth every stride. You need crampons and hiking boots in the winter as it was full of ice and snow. Beautiful experience.

reviews.name: 1984laurabohrn
reviews.title: Stunning, beautiful!
reviews.comment: My husband and two children (aged 6 and 10) spent two days here travelling from Canada. What a beautiful place. It is one of my favorite places I have ever visited. Rangers at the visitor Centre were very helpful and my kids enjoyed visiting with them. They both completed the Junior Ranger Program and had a lot of fun learning about this area. We hiked Mossy Trail and Queens Garden/Navajo Loop. It was absolutely stunning and breathtaking. So peaceful. Everyone needs to visit here in the Winter. We can’t wait to come back one day!

reviews.name: Larry C
reviews.title: Amazing Scenery For Photo Ops
reviews.comment: We travel I-15 yearly from Alberta to Arizona and finally decided to check one more thing off of our bucket list. We went to Bryce Canyon National Park. It is amazing ! Awesome ! Inspiring ! We drove up the mountain on the well maintained paved road, stopping at every viewing spot along the way. We did some walking and some stair climbing for better views, but this park is for everyone and anyone. Many of the views can be appreciated without ever geting out of your vehicles. Minimal walking is required for a better view from the lookouts. There are free bus shuttles if you prefer to not drive at all. Or, for the real dedicated hiker, you can hike the trails following close to the rim, from one lookout to the next until you reach the top, and then take the shuttle back down to your parked vehicle. Dress warm and in layers as the temperature can vary at higher altitude (8,900ft) The scenery is amazing with magnificent colors. Bryce Canyon National Park was our Highlight spot for 2019. HANDS DOWN the best by far.

reviews.name: Ron F
reviews.title: National Park bucket list
reviews.comment: What a beautiful awsome natural wonder. This was part 1 of our 3 stop national park tour and after seeing Zion and Capitol Reef Bryce is #1. I always tell everyone that the Grand Canyon area is my most favorite place I have ever seen. Bryce Canyon is right up there.

reviews.name: jesse o
reviews.title: Magnificent
reviews.comment: Sad I didn’t have a blue sky day as in earlier visits but was so glad to see snow amongst the wonderful hoodoos! Hiking trails are limited in early season and driving roads too. But this is one of the most amazing spots in all of the United States! And it gets a lot more busy after April.

reviews.name: Gary S
reviews.title: Best of the mighty 5 in Utah
reviews.comment: Brice canyon is breathtaking. Only wish we had come when we were younger so we could have done more hiking. I thought this was the most beautiful of all the parks we visited this summer.

reviews.name: gwen h
reviews.title: National Park
reviews.comment: Beautiful in the winter. Snow capped mountains and canyons Lot of photo opps. Amazing to see. Jaw dropping views.

reviews.name: Brad F
reviews.title: Wonderful National Park
reviews.comment: Bryce is a bit harder to reach that other area parks, but it’s worth the time to visit. Amazing views and vistas abound. There is great hiking, which is what we did. The scenic drive is an out-and-back with many pull offs for pictures. Wonderful natural wonder.

reviews.name: Thomas M
reviews.title: Superbly Beautiful National Park
reviews.comment: Even the scenic drive (Route 89) to get to this fabulous park is outstanding and enjoyable. Bryce Canyon, however, will take your breath away. In my opinion, it is more beautiful than the Grand Canyon. Hiking among the Hoodoos is easy and exhilarating. At least half a day is required but you can easily spend more time at this natural wonder. Drive all the way to the end of the scenic park road (the only one) and work your way back. That way all the turnoffs and scenic points and lookouts will be on your right hand side, making it easy ti enter and leave. This is a Must See attraction.

reviews.name: CindyLou2262
reviews.title: Forfilled a dream
reviews.comment:
Bryce canyon, I wasn’t expecting so much snow.
For as long as I can remember I’ve been wanting to go to Bryce but I wasn’t expecting to go there in the winter time. Although it was beautiful we really didn’t bring the proper hiking shoes nor equipment. I actually brought some really cute summer dresses and sandals to wear in the warm weather that didn’t even come out of my bag.
Someone took the time to make a little snow people, one even had a stick for its little snow dog, they were so dang cute!
I feel blessed that I was able to go to two national parks on my journey back from California to Colorado. Now I must go back in the summer time to go to the places I really wanted to hike.

reviews.name: Katherine W
reviews.title: Unique with Great Vantage Points
reviews.comment: Bryce was interesting to visit as it has so many unique overlooks as well as wide open vantage points out across the land. It is different from anything I have seen. It was windy when we were there, but we enjoyed the hikes. Sad I didn’t see any prairie dogs! The only drawback was that the bathrooms at the end of the drive to Rainbow needed to be cleaned more regularly or at least checked on that day! There are multiple bathrooms up there; however, my spouse and I both came out of separate ones with the same opinion and heard others remarking of the same as they came out of others. We didn’t let this bother us though since the park itself was great!

reviews.name: Wayne S
reviews.title: Very scenic
reviews.comment: We were here after a large snow storm. Limited hiking but the views were awesome!! The Bruce lookout was by far the best in my opinion.

reviews.name: RoadWarrior_BOS
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon in the winter is uniquely beautiful, open, and still accessible.
reviews.comment: Entered Bryce Canyon National Park, expecting the park was open, but after paying $35, we learned that access was supposedly limited due to fairly deep snow. Our group was surprised that although limited we were able to thoroughly enjoy Sunset Point, hike several great trails, and enjoy great views like Wall Street, Inspiration Point, and others. Bryce Canyon hoodoos covered with beautiful light Utah snow are very special and worth every penny of the $35 entry fee. We had just come from Zion and actually enjoyed the deeper snow, different geology, and geomorphology of Bryce. The area outside Bryce on Route 63 has a few tacky outside-of-the-park attractions. Springdale, Utah outside of Zion provides nicer facilities than the area outside of Bryce. Best time of year to enjoy both is probably mid fall or late spring. Plan to spend at least two days at each. There's lots to see, do, and hike in both parks.

reviews.name: Gainesville57
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: My wife and I were able to view Sunrise Point, Inspiration Point, and Bryce Point with the rest of the viewing areas closed due to snow and road conditions. These areas were terrific to see with an added bonus of snow covered hoodoos.

reviews.name: Hermes_NL 🇳🇱
reviews.title: Magnificent and different from Grand Canyon and Zion
reviews.comment:
When pushed hard, I would probably pick Bryce above Grand Canyon or Zion ... because it is so unique and so mesmerizing. In any case, they are fairly close together, all in the same geological setting and make for a good week trip together.
Bryce Canyon is not really a Canyon but a large erosional feature in the uppermost step of the Escalante staircase of the broken-up Colorado plateau .. also for the geological layman the difference with a Canyon is clear since the cliff is essentially one-sided. The easygoing rim trail gives walking distance access to the most important viewpoints, and notably sunset point and sunrise point which are close together. By walking the Navajo trail from Sunset Point to Sunrise Point (or vice versa) one has immediate access to the Amphitheatre itself and can get up close and personal with the Hoodoos. If you do one thing in Bryce beyond walking the rim, it should be walking the Navajo trail, maybe combined with Wall Street.
We found the Lodge inside the park excellent accomodation also in Winter (close January and February though). Crawling distance from the rim which makes it easy to visit Sunset and Sunrise points at the right times of the day. Dinner is a 15 minute drive to e.g. Bryce Canyon Pines (recommended) in Bryce Canyon City just outside the National Park.

reviews.name: D D
reviews.title: Go here before you go to Zion
reviews.comment: We ad just come from Zion so this was actually a bit of a letdown, as we had seen similar formations and topography there. The different nature of the rock ( crumbly) was readily evident here as opposed to the harder sandstone at ZIon but seemed less impressive. If we had done them in reverse order we would have enjoyed Bryce much more.

reviews.name: chelsealynne
reviews.title: Beautiful National Park
reviews.comment: The formations at Bryce are just breathtaking. I highly recommend the fairyland loop for solitude and beauty. Everything in nature is better with less people crowding your views. Friendly rangers and nice facilities. Shop with food and souvenirs at sunrise point.

reviews.name: Heidi J
reviews.title: A must do
reviews.comment: Buy a National Parks Pass. They are so worth the money! The shuttle doesn't seem to run during the winter but Bryce is small enough it's easy to get around. Breathtaking! It's an easy drive from Zion and Kanab.

reviews.name: RICART75
reviews.title: No words.....
reviews.comment:
This is our favorite National Park.
This is no slight to Glacier, Grand Canyon, Yellowstone, etc.; all of which contain spectacular, amazing, incredible, jaw-dropping natural wonder.
There is just something, for us, so ethereally beautiful and enthralling, when viewing this vast expanse of hoodoos.
There are two truths we find consistently apply here: 1) Pictures are great for memories, but nothing compares to the actual viewing, and
2) no words, no matter how heartfelt, can truly convey the impact of actually seeing this place.
If one has any opportunity to do it, this is definitely a bucket list experience not to be missed.

reviews.name: Nancy F
reviews.title: Lots of great hiking trails
reviews.comment: Spectacular scenery. Easy hike down Sunset Point, a little tough going back up. Got some beautiful photos at Inspiration Point at sunset with the full moon rising.

reviews.name: caml77
reviews.title: Phenomenal Fairylike Hoodoos
reviews.comment:
From any angle there are classic photo opportunities. We went on the Navajo/Queen’s Garden Trail. Breathtaking in 2 ways. Fantastic views and steep switchbacks to get back up the canyon at the end of the hike no matter which way. We started at Sunrise Point. $:
Don’t miss the later quick stop viewpoints including Fairview and Rainbow. The natural birch at the Arch stop is a must see. Easily a full day of hikes and photos.

reviews.name: automoto65
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Great place for winter fun. It was cold but there was a bunch of snow and my teenagers had fun ice skating, cross country skiing and eating! Would definitely recommend a winter visit.

reviews.name: TeresaJ23
reviews.title: Trail Rides and Night Sky!
reviews.comment:
We met at the Bryce Canyon Lodge inside the park to start out 3 hour trail ride.
We went down to the corral and I was matched up with Blaze and my husband was on a mule named Clyde. The wranglers were friendly and also let us know what we needed to do to stay safe on the ride. The scenery from the trails was breathtaking! I do have to say that at times those turns were tight on steep terrain so I just trusted the horse! It was truly a once in a lifetime experience! I would highly recommend this adventure!
Bryce Canyon itself is incredible! We drove to the highest point and stopped at all the outlooks on the way down, then we hopped on the tourist bus to do a few more!!
We went back at night, the views without any light pollution was unbelievable, almost forgot how incredible the Milky Way is to observe.
Love this National Park!!!

reviews.name: David A
reviews.title: Awesome area to relax and walk
reviews.comment: Really nice walk from the sunrise spot to the sundown spot around 2 MLS. Is a nice site than the grand canyon

reviews.name: LinLan8
reviews.title: Most unique
reviews.comment: We visited at the end of October and the park was not crowded. There were no shuttle buses running, so we drove to all of the viewpoints by car. Unfortunately, there was a cold spell at the time, and we were viewing the sites in the early morning in mid-teen temperatures. Throw in the wind chill and an elevation of (8000'-9000'), and it was cold. Most of the popular viewpoints are centered around the hoodoo amphitheater (see photos). This is essence of Bryce Canyon National Park. This is where the exciting hiking and horse trails are located, and where you will find the most awesome land features. They is a vast array of hiking opportunities, both easy and difficult. We watched a film in the visitors center (22 minutes) that gave a very general overview of the park's history. We stayed at the Best Western near the park entrance which afforded us quick access. There are restaurants near the entrance to the park.

reviews.name: Susan A
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: We did Zion first and it was beautiful, but we thought Bryce Canyon even better. Got there early and hopped the shuttle. Did the shuttle all the way back to where we parked at lodge and had been told to drive your own car to the end. Well that was a great recommendation, as you could stop at your leisure without long walks to viewpoints in that altitude. We drove all the way to the end and boy was it worth it. Highly recommend to just drive it yourself.

reviews.name: jimmi
reviews.title: Stunning, and easy to get around
reviews.comment: stunning, and easy to get around, the shuttle system is efficient and the stops well planned.if you just did the rim trail and the shuttle stops you would be impressed and awe struck but if your able take one of the many hiking routes down into the canyon itself you WILL come out with an experience that you carry for life time.

reviews.name: Snarth
reviews.title: Just incredible, and different from Zion
reviews.comment: We met travelers who were not sure whether to make the trip from Zion to Bryce. YES, do it! Bryce is so different from Zion and can be done in a day trip from there. The drive itself is worthwhile and the hoodoos at Bryce are truly spectacular.

reviews.name: drabcio
reviews.title: Awesome National Park
reviews.comment: Absolutely lovely place, We took most of the hikes - half a day is enough, the view are just wonderful, you can also ride a horse in the park. Worth of seeing. Quite chilly in October, but very sunny.

reviews.name: JOSEPH M
reviews.title: It's beautiful, magnificent, breath-taking
reviews.comment: Don't miss Bryce and Zion National Parks, which can be seen and enjoyed in two days. Both parks are quite distinct, provide awesome views, plenty of places to hike or just drive your car and stop and enjoy. Bring your camera!

reviews.name: twiztrussler
reviews.title: AMAZING PLACE!!!
reviews.comment:
We spent a truly amazing day here at Bryce Canyon. The drive into the Canyon is nothing much and does not prepare you for the views you are about to witness. Yes it was a little bit unclear were you need to go to, but the visitors center is a must and will give you the necessary pointers. From the visitors center car park it is possible to walk into the canyon, but we found it better to move your car up to Sunset point. Yes there are lots of cars and tour buses but we had no issues parking. Here it is a short walk to the Rim Trail. Our first view out into the canyon just blew us away. Amazing!! Stunning ... there's not enough words to describe the place. Move away from the busy areas and you will we rewarded. /We chose to walk the North Rim Trail around to Bryce Point where we then descended in to the Canyon on the Peek-a-boo Trailhead. Yes you need to be well prepared and have a good level of fitness as the walk down to the canyon floor is often steep and winding, but you are rewarded at every turn because the views are stunning. It just keeps on getting better, you think you've seen the best but then you turn the next corner and.... Be careful it's dangerous in places and take plenty of water and have the correct footwear. We saw plenty of people badly prepared and some taking big risks. The canyon floor is a long way down, it's worth it, but remember you have to climb back up to the car parks....
Stunning Place.....

reviews.name: sreiter2017
reviews.title: THE most beautiful place on earth!!
reviews.comment:
I haven’t been hiking here for nearly 20 years, and when we returned last month it was even more spectacular than I remembered.
There are hikes for people of all ages and levels. The sunrise and sunset are not to be missed....

reviews.name: Travelbugsforlife
reviews.title: Unbelievable beauty! Each lookout point is so unique.
reviews.comment: We enjoyed a few days in Bryce Canyon National Park. We came from Capitol Reef so we ended up hiking the Mossy cave trail before getting to the Park's proper entrance. Once we arrived we started at the visitor center, they have some interactive displays, a really nice gift store and an informative movie. We opted to start the next day with the scenic drive to try to beat some of the crowds and it worked perfectly. TIP: For the scenic drive, go all the way to the end Yovimpa point, then stop at each lookout on your way back. All the lookouts are on the left side of the road so if you do them all on your way back you are not having to cross traffic, easy in and out and by starting at the end we were by ourselves at several lookouts. Lots of great hiking in this park. The elevation may impact some people. I also thought the rating of the hikes was not accurate, especially given the elevation. Seemed like some of the easy should be listed as more moderate. Queens Garden is the least steep to get into the Caynon but it is still steep.

reviews.name: Heidi g
reviews.title: Another beautiful piece of America!
reviews.comment: We 3 (mom, dad, and tween son) ventured to Bryce after a 3 day experience in Zion and were just as amazed! Praise God they are different! We drove the scenic drive upon arrival one afternoon after studying the park brochure and map from the ranger's station. We got out at every stop on the map! Took pix and did some hikes which were wonderful! Highly recommend hiking the Bristlecone Trail at the last stop out on the point as well as hiking down either Sunrise or Sunset Points to the valley and also checking out Inspiration Point hike, all easy to moderate. Remember water, sun hat, sunglasses, and good shoes with traction when hiking in southern Utah! So the special things about Bryce include the hoodoos, the pine trees, the light colored stone, and the free shuttles (Zion has them too). You gotta go!

reviews.name: chucktodd75
reviews.title: Count the Hoodoos
reviews.comment: Someone asked me what my first choice was: Grand Canyon, Bryce or Zion. When pushed I would say Bryce but in reality each is memorable for different reasons. Grand Canyon for it's hugeness, Bryce for it's other-worldness, and Zion because you're at the bottom looking up.

reviews.name: chckmate8
reviews.title: Beautiful and unique geological formations
reviews.comment:
The views of the canyon from the ridges is spectacular. The hoodoos are the highlight and you have to wonder what forces of nature combined to make such a unique display that is not found elsewhere.
This is vastly different than the Grand canyon and vastly different than say Arches or Zion. You have to see them all. We stayed overnight in the nearby town hotels.

reviews.name: trishcunningham
reviews.title: More spectacular than imagined...
reviews.comment: Amazing scenery makes this well worth a visit. The shuttle bus takes you conveniently from your hotel or camp spot to park and all main stops within.

reviews.name: Ashley P
reviews.title: WOW- everywhere is a view!
reviews.comment: We came to the area because of Zion, but we were SPECTACULARLY impressed with Bryce Canyon! Everywhere is breath taking! We only had one day so we parked at Sunrise Point hiked Queens Garden to Navajo, around Peekaboo Loop and out via Navajo Wallstreet to Sunset Point. I felt like we saw the majority of the park. Wallstreet was an awesome up hill, but you may prefer to start at Sunset so you don’t have an incline the whole way up*** and end at Queens Garden. After the whole vacation, we actually decided we liked Bryce the best!

reviews.name: Cherith7
reviews.title: National park over view
reviews.comment: There was way too much to see in a one day visit but the scenic drive tour was the best way to see the highlights. The path ways to the trails were so inviting that l will make a return trip for the hikes. The views were truly breathe-taking. Definitely a must see in person place to visit.

reviews.name: Valerie M
reviews.title: Better than the Grand Canyon!
reviews.comment: Bryce was so naturally beautiful! Hard to believe how vast this area is---and so much better than the Grand Canyon. Put in on your list of must sees!

reviews.name: Melinda
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Spent the weekend here with my husband. The park is so beautiful! As pretty as it is from the ridge, the real wonder is seen when you hike down inside. Pictures don’t do it justice! Besides the Queens garden trail and the Navajo loop trail which allow you to see the magnificent Wall Street, check out the Mossy Cave Trail which is located just outside the park on the highway. Well worth the visit!

reviews.name: Leslieonthego
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment:
What a view! A trip of a lifetime. Go! You won’t be disappointed. A beautiful natural element and a must see in your lifetime. The views are spectacular and the trails are well maintained.
Take. Tour or explore on your own. The fall is a great time to go and experience the grand nature at its best!

reviews.name: Senioronabudget
reviews.title: And now for something completely different
reviews.comment: No where in the world can you see this. From the rim it is wonderful, from the trails wonderful. Whether you spend an hour or week here, you will always experience something different each minute.

reviews.name: Ron1733
reviews.title: Consistently in our Top 5 National Parks- gorgeous and accessible!
reviews.comment: We did a day trip from St George and had a wonderful time. Just driving the rim road with its spectacular overlooks is a great way to get a feel for all the variety of hoodoos, canyons, and expansive scenery, but the real race comes alive when you drop below the rim one of the trails. Our favorite is the Queens Garden Loop off of Sunrise point, connecting to the Navajo Loop up to Sunset Point-approximately 2 miles and a wide variety of scenery.

reviews.name: Sightsee751697
reviews.title: beautiful with many options
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is a beautiful place. We saw it at dawn (get there about 1/2 hr early to take in the experience). We saw the night sky through three telescopes as part of park ranger experience (get there early, too). There are multiple trail options - some along the canyon rim and many into the basin. The hoodos are quite remarkable. We also took 3 hour free guided bus tour (tickets and boarding at the main shuttle station) to Rainbow Point with an experienced guide as we stopped at multiple sights coming and going. He spoke about the development of formations and pointed out some interesting formations we likely would have missed. Worth the three days we spent there.

reviews.name: DerAlteBach
reviews.title: My #1 favorite National Park
reviews.comment:
If you have time to visit only one National Park, I urge you to make it Bryce Canyon. The rock formations will take your breath away. The views are spectacular. Wherever you look, you see nature at its grandest.
The Park can easily be visited in one day, including a few easy hikes.
Strongly recommended.

reviews.name: Jill H
reviews.title: Just Go
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon National Park is my husbands favorite park. It’s just absolutely breathtaking. We visited on October 31st and we were disappointed that the park buses had stopped running on October 20th. We hiked the rim trail from Bryce Point to Inspiration Point to Sunset Point. (Restrooms are closed for the season at inspiration point but are open at sunset point). The views are spectacular. You won’t be disappointed

reviews.name: Jmits1
reviews.title: Just When You Think You've Seen It All! You Haven't!
reviews.comment: We were there the last week of September 1.5 days and the weather was perfect. (We were told that the park was having record numbers for September.) Prior to our trip I read a ton of reviews which were so helpful. I was pleased that someone mentioned the free Rainbow Point Tour offered by the park. You must make reservations in advance by phone or purchase tickets at Ruby's Inn. The tour shuttle leaves from Bryce City. We arrived midday so we took the 1:30 PM tour which was excellent. April was our guide, a local teacher and rancher who educated us and told many, wonderful stories. Do note that you will not see some of the recommended views on the tour but it is well worth it to get an overview and still see a ton. We went back a 2nd day to see and walk trails at Bryce, Inspiration, & Sunset Points. All the views are different and it was so clear you could see 100 miles!

reviews.name: Maryléne
reviews.title: You can't miss this Park
reviews.comment:
We spent one entire day visiting the Park and nothing that I would say here can describe the amazement and hugeness of what we saw. It's just wonderful.
We went on June, but due the bad heather conditions during winter some of the trails were closed (like the Navajo Loop for example). But we were able to do the Queens Garden, Peek a Boo Loop and the Rim Trail, they are all very easy to do.
Go early in the morning to enjoy the Park, otherwise it can be crowded.

reviews.name: Sue L
reviews.title: One of the most amazing places we saw
reviews.comment: This place is jaw-dropping. It was absolutely one of the most amazing natural wonders we have ever seen. Tons of pictures of hoodoos. The color was amazing. We went to about every lookout we could find just to see it from different angles. It was breathtaking for sure!

reviews.name: 387indy
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon National Park
reviews.comment: In Southwestern Utah, the main feature of the park is Bryce Canyon; which is not a canyon. It's a collection of giant natural amplitheaters. Distintive due to geological structures called hoodoos. These rock structures are colors of red, or orange and white, the height varies 8,000 to 9,000 feet.

reviews.name: Sergei R
reviews.title: Most amazing natural wonder I have visited in my life
reviews.comment: You simply must go there to this natural wonder. Simply unbelievable. You really want to take pictures every few feet. I would also recommend going on several trails. Don't stick with "Queens Garden" only. In my opinion the most spectacular one is "Peek-a-Boo"' trail. Really breathtaking.

reviews.name: Linda-wanderer
reviews.title: MY FRIEND CRIED
reviews.comment: We took our friend from England and she went down the Sunset/Sunrise trail and actually cried at the beauty of this place. Views are terrific from every point. You don't need to hike into the canyon (actually it's an amphitheater) as the rim walk is fairly flat and even wheelchair friendly. Plenty of parking though it was busy as the shuttle seemed to have ended for the season.

reviews.name: James
reviews.title: Don't miss Bryce NP. Just incredible!
reviews.comment: So amazing to get right up to the canyon rim, in so many different spots along the rim drive, and also right from the lodge!

reviews.name: Bob C
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: Everywhere you look, there’s beauty! The shuttle stopped running For the season 4 days before we arrived, but by self driving we could stop and walk wherever we chose. Very cold at night - way below zero Celcius, and cool days, but refreshing. So much fascinating scenery!

reviews.name: Travel81213484
reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: Weather was great, we parked at sunset point, hiked the Navajo loop trail combined with the queens trail. Not difficult at all, some steep bits when you come back up. There’s toilets at the car park, we waited until sunset but the view looked the same to us so sat in the car until completed darkness (not many people around at this point) and were treated to a great view of be milkyway. This is a must as there’s hardly any light pollution up here.

reviews.name: Aussienando
reviews.title: Wow - breathtaking ! And wonderful to hike through - not to be missed
reviews.comment: I absolutely loved Bryce Canyon (and Zion and Capital Reef) - each park in Utah is unique and all are wonderful. Bryce Canyon is spectacular to see from above and below. We did the Navajo and Queen's Garden loop - a perfect hike of around 1.5hours - going down via Navajo. Lots of great photos to remind me of the beauty.

reviews.name: NJW646
reviews.title: An inspiring experience
reviews.comment: Spent 2 days hiking here. The Fairyland Loop Trail was fabulous hiking among the hoodoos. The dry heat and elevation make it somewhat challenging, so bring plenty of water and snacks. The views are definitely worth it!

reviews.name: Home-By9
reviews.title: Beautiful National Park
reviews.comment: Beautiful, colorful rock formations unlike anywhere else in the world. Plenty of overlooks. Take time to stop at each as the view is different. The park draws a large number of visitors, so parking at the overlooks can sometimes be difficult. A tip, take the park shuttle or wait until around 3 or 4 in the afternoon to go to the park, when there is less traffic and parking at the overlooks will be easier. However, if you are doing any hiking you will want to go earlier in tne day. This is a must ses national park.

reviews.name: Deborah D
reviews.title: SPECTACULAR NATIONAL PARK
reviews.comment: This was my 3rd trip to BRYCE CANYON NATIONAL PARK & my most significant one! September is a great month to visit due to cooler weather & less number of people visiting/walking within the Park & it's trails! Free refillable bottle water stations is available through out the Park. The Park employees were very helpful when suggesting which trials were less strenuous & easier to walk/navigate even if one uses a cane! Another Plus at this Park are their free SHUTTLES from their multiple parking lots to the main Park Trial Heads!

reviews.name: CKT808
reviews.title: Amazing Formations
reviews.comment: The overlooks at Bryce Canyon show amazing formations called hoodoos. This is the largest collection of hoodoos in the world. Their geology is interesting, but it is amazing just to view all the shapes and colors. There are a number of overlooks for viewing the canyon. This is our fifth visit to the park, and it is still breathtaking. There are lots of people and limited parking, but you can take a park bus from the visitor center.

reviews.name: S C
reviews.title: Spectacular experience
reviews.comment: Well coordinated shuttle service was very welcoming. Visitor center staff very knowledgeable and food at the lodge excellent. But most importantly....the views and experience of the Carmel highway are beyond words.

reviews.name: Steve M
reviews.title: Just amazing
reviews.comment: The pictures can tell you what to expect, but they really can't capture the experience of seeing it. You can get the highlights in a few hours, especially if you choose not to hike (but, you should at least do the Navajo loop if you're physically able) If you are coming to this area of Utah, there is no reason not to set aside at least an afternoon for Bryce.

reviews.name: Rafael C
reviews.title: Nature at it's most
reviews.comment: Not a tourist destination, not a lot of people around, yet mostly coming from Europe, hey guys, get to know your own country, this is one of the most impressive National parks; Nature or the hand of God had done such a beauty over millions of years; it is breathtaking. Fly to Utah, take your car or RV and drive for hours admiring the jewel.

reviews.name: Aslan's Traveler
reviews.title: Reserve the Rainbow Point Tour, and get below the rim
reviews.comment: The main park shuttles will take you only as far back as Bryce point (which is less than 1/2 the park), and really doesn't include a "tour". But you can reserve a free tour that will take you all the way out to Rainbow Point, and will include a tour guide who will tell you all about the park and the surrounding area. It's a three hour tour, given twice a day and costs nothing. Call or stop by the Shuttle station just outside the park to reserve. Definitely hike along the Rim Trail and see all of the main points--Bryce, Sunset, Sunrise--but also take some time to get below the rim. The Navajo loop is 500ft down and up, but it's worth the climb to get a completely different view of the hoodoos. Even if you only go part of the way, it's worth getting down into the canyon.

reviews.name: timj123
reviews.title: Hiking the rim
reviews.comment: If you have only one day in Bryce, definitely hike the rim trail. From Fairyland to Brice Point is 5.5 miles but there are shorter options. Their shuttle routes are great for this. We took the shuttle to Bryce Point, walked around and then shuttled to Inspiration Point, both lower and upper. This is a rather steep incline, but well worth it. We then walked to Sunset and Sunrise points and caught the shuttle back to the visitors center. We then drove to Rainbow Point, at the end of the park, with very little traffic. This allowed for sunset views with far less people than the other points. I highly recommend the shuttle system to save parking hassles and to save a lot of time.

reviews.name: Randy, Mary Connor
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon--Spectacular!!
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon National Park is beautiful and the visitor access is well-organized. Parking is ample and the shuttles run frequently. Rangers are always glad to help. Gift shop prices were very reasonable. The most "user-friendly" park we visited of the 12 parks we went to on this trip. (Always plan to arrive early when visiting national parks because mid-day and early afternoon traffic can be stressful.)The views here are spectacular and whether you are a hiker, or just a sight-seer, you will enjoy this place. Vantage points never seemed too crowded. We loved it!

reviews.name: Michael C
reviews.title: Day Trip to the head of the steps
reviews.comment:
Visited Bruce Canyon in south Utah. I have never seen such natural beauty in all my life. Completed a hike along the rim, absolutely fantastic. Be careful with regards to altitude sickness it just suddenly comes on.
See the photos but you really have to see it live to appreciate it.

reviews.name: Ursus_Polaris
reviews.title: A must see !
reviews.comment:
I visited for a day in early Oct. My wife and I was on a 10 days US Southwest roadtrip.
Bryce Canyon N P was one of the highlights. We soent a day, and it was needed. We walked the combined Queens and Canyon loop, which was fantastic. And we drove the rim trip, which had some very nice viewpoints.
In all a fantastic experience

reviews.name: Bob W
reviews.title: an amazing place
reviews.comment: One of the worlds most spectacular natural wonder. Awe inspiring views and amazing trails. Easy walk to lookout points and a shuttle service to drive you around,

reviews.name: Minnesota42
reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: This, and Arches, were by far our favorite parks in UT. We stopped at the visitor center, got a feel for what the park was about and then drove to the far end of the scenic lookouts and worked our way back, with all of the pull offs now on our right side. Each stop was more amazing than the last and we just loved it. Our final stop was the Sunset overlook and it was absolutely amazing. If you have the ability to hike this would make an amazing hike down in the canyon between the spired rock formations. If you are going to UT to see the amazing rock formations, this park is a must see.

reviews.name: Eunice
reviews.title: Breath taking
reviews.comment: Had a great time driving to Bryce from Las Vegas. It was a 4hr drive, 200miles from Vegas. Cost $30 dollars to go into the park but if you want to see other parks it’s best you get the $80 card that allows you to enter all the parks in the USA.

reviews.name: Robert G
reviews.title: Interesting place
reviews.comment:
Bryce is unusual due to geological structures called hoodoo. The red, orange, and white colors of the rocks provide spectacular views. By driving around the rim of the "canyon" you can stop at various viewpoints and take a short walk (usually only a few hundred yards) to see the amazing sites.
An interesting option is to take a horseback ride down to the floor of the "canyon" and see the hoodoos from the bottom looking up.

reviews.name: PatD
reviews.title: Second visit
reviews.comment: Absolutely stunning scenery. Nowhere else in the world to match this. A couple of days will see the most of the area unless you intend to hike. Stayed in Ruby’s Inn which is really central and local to all the amenities

reviews.name: Hawaiian Traverler
reviews.title: An Exhilarating Experience at Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment:
This was our first trip to Utah and Bryce Canyon was on the top of my list. The hoodoos were "out of this world"! I thought we were on another planet!
We took in the Rainbow Tour in the morning and this free tour was just awesome!
Our driver /tour director was very knowledgeable and pleasant. He walked with us various stops and shared the history of the area. We visited Bryce Canyon in early
October and was blessed with fall colors!!! The quaking aspens were so beautiful and
added a new dimension to our visit to Bryce Canyon. If you go to Bryce Canyon, taking the Rainbow Tour is a must.........A most memorable experience!

reviews.name: Elaine N
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon--"Rubyville" Terrible
reviews.comment: All the national parks in Utah are different. But, this one has hoodoos! Of course, great hikes. Fun photo opportunities. If you like to horseback ride you must do the one offered at Bryce Canyon Lodge. May be the best trail ride I have ever done. If possible stay at the Lodge. The overly tacky "Rubyville" outside the park leaves a bad taste. It could have been done right--I have seem it, but this--in every way is just terrible. Tourist tacky.

reviews.name: Sylvia G
reviews.title: Columbus Weekend Adventure
reviews.comment: Lots of different hikes for different ages and strengths including strenuous. Plenty of young, elderly and friendly tourists. Popular trails like the popular view points and Navajo Loop/Queens Garden had lots of tourists. Longer tougher trails less people. Weather was mid 50s in midday and early morning and late evening low 30s but wasnt bad during hikes felt warm after hiking an hour. Great views and trails clearly marked. Plenty of bathrooms. Not alot of dining selections in area so pack snacks. Great for a weekend stop.

reviews.name: Scott S
reviews.title: Last minute detour
reviews.comment: We were driving by from Kanab on the way to Salt Lake and we had never been, so we stopped. $35 to get into park, but it was well worth it. Glad we decided to go. Views are spectacular and the buses the park provides make it easy to get around without having to worry about parking.

reviews.name: karo
reviews.title: Best National Park
reviews.comment: This is my favorite park in USA. Rock formations are astonishing, it's just incredible what nature can create! The short hike via the Queen's trail and the Navajo trail is beautiful.

reviews.name: joaniemaria
reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.comment: Impressive Bryce Canyon views of hoodoos. This is a must visit national park in Utah. It is super scenic and beautiful. I would love to hike down some of the trails and see the view from the bottom of the canyons. It is truly glorious.

reviews.name: Gary S
reviews.title: Wonder palce to visit & photograph
reviews.comment: I went to Bryce Canyon to observe and photography nature's wonder. It was awesome and in Oct the temps were nice and the crowds were not bad. I could actually get parking at most viewpoints, But, I would highly recommend using the Bryce shuttle that you boards in the town outside of Bryce NP. All the viewpoints on the regular shuttle are worth stopping at and the shuttle comes by every 10-12 min. You can also hike allow the canyon rims to the next stop. There is also a special free park shuttle at 9am & 130pm with a tour guide that takes you down the other road to rainbow point for a 3+hr ride, but you have to signup for this with 48 hrs of the departure, great tour. some of those viewpoints are crowded for parking.

reviews.name: slpro
reviews.title: Utah must see!
reviews.comment: Followed up our Zion NP visit with a trip to Bryce, don't miss this gem. This beautiful park is so different from Utah's other NP's, it's a must see. Enjoy hiking around the canyons many trails/viewpoints "up top" or venture down in the canyon. Be sure to allow plenty of time for the lower hikes, they require a bit more time but are definitely worth it. There is a lot more to see if you drive yourself in at least once, many of the views are not on the NP shuttle.

reviews.name: Len Rutledge
reviews.title: Fascinating National Park
reviews.comment:
The starting point for a visit should be the Visitor Center. Here you will find information at the Ranger Help Desk, exhibits, a 22-minute film and maps and souvenirs.
Bryce is not a single canyon unlike say the Grand Canyon. It is a series of huge amphitheatres carved into a high plateau. They are huge and are filled with irregularly eroded spires of rock called hoodoos. Bryce contains the largest concentration of hoodoos in the world.
Over two million visitors come to Bryce National Park each year, most in the March to October period. Every visitor spends at least some time marvelling at the views from the four main viewpoints and walking the trails between them. I strongly suggest the 1.6 kilometer paved trail along the edge of the amphitheatre between Sunset and Sunrise Points. Then you need to venture down into the hoodoos via the Navajo Loop Trail or the Queens Garden Trail.
Accommodation within the park is limited to the rustic Lodge at Bryce Canyon and the North and South campgrounds which are near the Lodge and the Visitor Center.

reviews.name: psuocn92
reviews.title: Favorite hike
reviews.comment: We were on a 12 day trip thru the Southwest National Parks. We did the Queen’s Garden hike which is fabulous and not to be missed!

reviews.name: Patrick O
reviews.title: More than expected
reviews.comment:
Spend 2 full days here in early October. Just a bit cold in the morning at 19 degrees but warmed up to the 60s in the afternoon. We dressed in layer and put extra clothes in the back pack as the day wore on. We went to the park early so we were able to find parking near the Sunrise point. After that we used the shuttle to return to our car.
Best hikes: Queens garden from Sunrise point to the bottom. Then return to Sunset point via the Navajo train via WALL street. Wall street was amazing especially coming from the bottom. We did all the rim hikes and took the bus to get back. Hidden Gem. Just outside the park entrance road, Mossy Cave
is 4 mi East on Hwy 12.This is a short scenic hike to a waterfall.

reviews.name: John L
reviews.title: OMG! What an experience!
reviews.comment: All three of the national parks that are part of the "Grand Staircase" are a wonder to behold. Bryce Canyon National Park is perhaps the most unique of the three parks with the many "hoodoos".

reviews.name: Clive A
reviews.title: What a view
reviews.comment: Amazing location stunning views. You will need your camera. The sites are better than you can imagine. Walking around this location is a must.

reviews.name: MERoots
reviews.title: Truly breathtaking
reviews.comment: At Bryce, visitors arrive at the rim of the canyon and look down. And what a sight ... from sorts of perspectives, views of magically colored cliffs and formations , spited, cut-out curtains of eroding rock. There are trails heading upward from the forested rim, or down, if you dare, into the canyon. The colors change with the light. My little granddaughter loves the hoodoos - the eroding formations that wind up looking like rock statues. Summer rains, freezing at night and expanding cracks in the rock, help erode these formations rapidly as geology goes. We tried out several moderate walks with stunning views. Bryce is not as crowded as Zion, but you still need to plan at least 6 months in advance for lodging. If you go to any Utah parks, make sure you see this one, too!

reviews.name: CapitanJimmy
reviews.title: Very pretty but slightly overrated!
reviews.comment:
Visited a couple of America's National and State parks recently, must say that Bryce was my least favourite and a bit overrated!
You get some nice views from Bryce/Inspiration Point but otherwise there's not an awful lot to it.. The walks are a bit mediocre and not all that scenic.. good for an afternoon or morning but not worth the entrance fee.

reviews.name: flzdmpm03
reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.comment: #2 on our tour of the Mighty Five. Magnificent and breathtaking...something more beautiful that the next....every turn is a new adventure! I just got a new camera and wow, I didn’t know where to turn nex! Lots of hiking trails and beautiful views everywhere! It was a bit chilly...9 degrees on Oct 11 when we were there. It did warm up during the day. Being a Florida Gal I was a bit chilly to say the least. But it was worth every minute!

reviews.name: Nicole B
reviews.title: Beautiful Experience
reviews.comment: We just did a hiking roadtrip to Colorado, Utah, and Arizona and I have to say Bryce Canyon in UT was my favorite one of all of our hikes. No matter which angle/point you are viewing the canyon from it is truly breathtaking! I suggest hopping on the free shuttle riding to the top and hiking down. The bus will stop at each point of interest so don't worry if your not really a hiker. If you choose not to hike all the way down at least hike sunset point down into the caverns....you won't be disappointed....it is so AMAZING!!!

reviews.name: dixiepeach
reviews.title: Wonderful views
reviews.comment: This is a gorgeous park that is most known for the hoodoos, the column-like rock formations seem throughout the park. Don’t miss Mossy Cave which is a short but beautiful walk. The only wildlife we saw were deer.

reviews.name: Elyse S
reviews.title: Most magnificent of the National Parks!
reviews.comment: Bryce is just breath taking! It is my favorite of the Mighty 5. The hoodoos were beyond explanation. Each view was exquisite! You can hike as much as you want or you can stop at each lookout and see plenty. Just right for over 65ers.

reviews.name: Yolo1962
reviews.title: Majestic and Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: I have never in my life seen anything as beautiful as the hoodoos in Bryce Canyon! It will absolutely take your breath away! A nice quick hike from Sunup Point to Sundown Point will give you a gorgeous view of the natural formations. There is also a good day hike down to the bottom and back up again. A great place for families to enjoy the views!

reviews.name: John B
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning
reviews.comment: If you are in Southern Utah this is a must see place. Breathtaking scenery at every turn. Photos in books do not do justice to this National Park. It is a real gem

reviews.name: wrpupkis
reviews.title: A truly awe-inspiring place to visit...
reviews.comment: We loved this park. The views were wonderful, marvelous, tremendous, breathtaking, etc. There are great walks almost anyone can take. A simple one is from sunrise point to sunset point. There some fairly easy one down into the canyon itself. This park should not be missed...

reviews.name: Sunshine15
reviews.title: Beautiful Experience
reviews.comment: We were blown away by the beauty of this national park. There is a shuttle that takes you from place to place and each is more beautiful than the next. Be prepared though to do a great deal of walking so wear comfortable shoes and clothing.

reviews.name: twoscratchy
reviews.title: Most beautiful place in USA.
reviews.comment:
A must visit for anyone visiting parks. You really need to hike in and away from rim crowds to appreciate the silence of the park
My favorite US park.

reviews.name: 71Joakim
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I had read a little about it, and seen some pictures, but it blew my mind! The wiew from the top was amazing and walking down the trail it was even better. If you're in Utah, go see this!

reviews.name: Excursion300768
reviews.title: Very nice trail scanic view
reviews.comment: If you are arriving by car you dont need to take shuttle bus, however the park offers it. Just drive to Sunset point, arrive earli, parking places are limited. Take the Navajo loop start your tour to Wall street and come up from Two bridges this is better than the opposite way. The canyon and tgis trail was really the best view what ever I experienced.

reviews.name: Wirunaways
reviews.title: Exceptional Park
reviews.comment: Great Park with lots of private property nearby to pay for the locals living expenses. It’s sad that they commercialize our nation’s parks like this. But it is what it is! The park itself is gorgeous. No need to rent a four wheeler, helicopter, or half dead horse. Get out and enjoy up close. Tour as much as you are able to while you can. Lots of sights are very close to the bus stops. Leave your car in town and don’t waste time looking for parking spots in the park. We saw lots of 70 and 80 year olds enjoying the sights. Lots of geology in the Big 5 so try to get on a Ranger Lead Tour for the best inside information. Make sure to visit the Visitor Center for the movie. Enjoy!

reviews.name: Grant E
reviews.title: My most favorite park Ive visited.
reviews.comment: HooDoos, you got to come see. One of the most beautiful places in the whole United States. So many colors, and shapes. Its just a beautiful place.

reviews.name: 7SXM
reviews.title: Hike if You Can, Go Even if You Cannot Hike - Stunning
reviews.comment: The United States is blessed with stunning national parks and monuments. We need to ensure we do everything possible to protect them. Bryce Canyon is at the top of the list in terms of beauty. You are currently able to drive a personal vehicle through the park, and this always makes visits more convenient. The park is small but mighty. We did it once...and want to go back and do it all over again!

reviews.name: Richard B
reviews.title: Incredible views.
reviews.comment: I knew this would be a good site to see canyon views. However,the views were totally amazing. The varied stone and colors of the formations were often breathtaking. The site is worth a trip, even if it is your only destination in Utah. That being said there are many other sites worth visiting in Utah.

reviews.name: Barbara M
reviews.title: This one is our favorite!
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is absolutely spectacular! We've seen the Grand Canyon and Zion National Park but Bryce took our breaths away! There is so much to see and hike. The rock formations are very colorful, interesting and so different from anything we've seen before.We picked up sandwiches in a country store near Sunset Point for lunch that day. If you don't want to travel out of the country start right here in the US with our own beautiful National Parks!

reviews.name: Linda
reviews.title: Best trip ever!
reviews.comment: We rode horses with Ruby's but hikers and bikes paradise too! Just incredible scenery and wonderful trails for everyone!

reviews.name: Karen in 50
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: Absolutely fantastic! Well worth a visit but wear good shoes as the climb back up is quite steep!!!!

reviews.name: Blairian
reviews.title: Second best park in America (after Zion)
reviews.comment: A great place to hike, bike, or just ride the bus and take in the views. We rode up from Red Canyon and into the park up to Inspiration Point. (12.5 miles). Then hiked the Rim trail, Navajo Gardens and the Queen trail, the back to Red Canyon on the Bikes. WHAT A GREAT DAY. October is a good time to go because the weather is nice and the crowds a bit diminished.

reviews.name: llee32018
reviews.title: wonderful spectacular views - well worth the time
reviews.comment: easy to trave around and stop unlike some of the parks. Bryce Point has nice short walks and beautiful views of the surrounding hoodoos and rock formations. Sunrise point walk to sunset point is about 30 minutes and wll worht it. Saw huge Elk sitting next to boardwalk by the petroglyphs. This was my favorite of the 5 parks we saw this trip.

reviews.name: Patty Nale D
reviews.title: Overwhelming Scenery!
reviews.comment:
Bryce Canyon is a popular park. If going, do your homework and plan for that. For us it meant parking in town and taking a shuttle to the park. That way, we didn't have to fight for a parking spot at either the visitors center or at any of the scenic overlooks. Plus the shuttle is free so why not!!
Speaking of scenic overlooks, the park is rich with magnificent views at every stop. If you HAVE to chose to only go to a few of our national parks, make sure Bryce is on your list.

reviews.name: Ronald D
reviews.title: The Big Hike
reviews.comment: Bryce Canyon is a must see if you are a real outdoors person.....most of the tourists just followed the top paved trails......take the hikes into the canyon, well worth the time and energy

reviews.name: Bottomshelfhockey
reviews.title: Amazing! - 5 out of 5 rating
reviews.comment:
We were at Bryce Canyon National Park on this late September Sunday and the park was busy. We used a National Parks Pass that allowed us to enter Bryce Canyon National Park for free. The regular price is $30 per vehicle.
Our first stop was the Ranger Station/ interpretive Centre which is about 100 yards pass the entrance on the right. There is no parking here. You will have to do a short drive pass the centre, turn left and park in the lot and a short walk back to the centre.
Sunset Point and the Rim Trail were our first stops after the info centre. Sunset Point has the short paved Rim trail hike near the parking lot. The trail is similar to the Grand Canyon Rim trail hike on a paved trail but much shorter.
Queens Garden Trail
We started on the Queens Garden trail (to the left on the Rim Trail) going clockwise on a gentle downhill. The trail here is mostly compact dirt and gravel with some exposed rocks. There is a lot of amazing scenery of the rock formations with lots of photo ops. One of the highlights here is the Queen Victoria formation, a rock formation that looks that looks like her profile.
Navajo Loop Trail
Adjoining the Queens Garden Trail is the Navajo Loop Trail. We joined the trail and hiked up the “Wall Street” trail. This trail is through a canyon “slot” with steep walls on both sides. The trail itself is compact dirt and gravel with some man-made steps and short switchbacks near the top. The hardest part of the trail is going up, about a 1/4 - 1/3 mile climb. It may be difficult for those with mobility and / or cardio issues but not impossible. We joined the Navajo Loop trail part way through the Queens Garden Trail and missed the Thors Hammer rock formation. Our loop of the trail was about (Queens Garden and partial Navajo Loop) was about 5 kilometers / 3.1 miles. If you want to do the complete Navajo Loop Trail and go downhill to start (probably the easier option), go to Sunset Point and start with “Wall Street” section.
Inspiration Point
At Inspiration Point there are 3 viewpoints with the first one being paved and closest to the parking lot. There are very short hikes, maybe 200-300 meters, for the next 2 viewpoints on a compact dirt and gravel trail. There are washrooms and a bus stop here. Inspiration Point has parking for about 60 cars.
Bryce Point
Bryce Point has a short paved trail with parking for about 75 cars. This is also a bus shuttle stop. There are some nice views and worth a 15-20 minute stop.
Natural Bridge Viewpoint has parking for 40+ vehicles and is worth a 5-10 minute stop.
Agua Canyon Viewpoint has parking for about 12 vehicles and is worth a 5 minute stop.
Rainbow Point is at the end of all the sites. There are parking spots for 100 plus vehicles and there are washrooms here. There is a short paved trail that offers views of the Canyon. We headed off to the right and the Bristlecone loop, an out and back with a loop about 1.6 km (1 mile) in length. The trail consists of mostly compact dirt and gravel. From the first lookout to the second one is uphill and about 200 meters.
If you have visited the Grand Canyon, Bryce Canyon National Park is comparable and even better according to my fellow hikers; not because of the size but the fact you are walking on the canyon floor with amazing rock formations surrounding you.
I would rate the overall experience 5 out of 5.
Notes &Tips:
• At the interpretive centre there are washrooms and a gift shop. Pick up your park map here. Plan your visit on the internet before you get here so you’ll know in advance what you want to see.
• The park “drive” is basically an out and back route on a paved road with our first “Point” being Sunrise and the last one being Rainbow / Yovimpa. There were a few other viewpoints that we did not stop at
• In total we spent about 6-7 hours in the park
• Bring suntan lotion and wear a hat. During the last week of September it was still hot and sunny.
• I would recommend a good pair of trail runners or day hikers and definitely no flip-flops!
• Pack a picnic lunch and bring water. There are picnic tables, washrooms and water near Bryce Canyon Lodge. Bryce Canyon Lodge has a restaurant.
• There was a good mix of old and young people with lots of seniors (65+). Some people were using hiking poles but in my opinion they are not necessary depending upon your age.
• Parking spots may be in short supply depending upon when you arrive and the time of the season. We were there during the last week of September and it was busy but were lucky to get a parking spot near Bryce Canyon Lodge and it was a very short walk to the Rim Trail. If the parking lot is full you will have to park in the overflow lots and take the free shuttle buses to the various viewpoints. The free shuttle buses stop at all the viewpoints throughout the park.
• We saw Steller’s Jay birds and a chipmunk on our hikes
• There are camp grounds inside the park
• We were on our first day of our 13 day Nevada-Arizona-Utah trip. We were off to Moab and Goblin Valley next. Other national parks we visited on this trip included Arches, Canyonlands and Zion. See my reviews.
• State and private parks we visited included Goblin Valley, Monument Valley, Lower and Upper Antelope and Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. See my reviews.
• Buy an annual pass if you plan to visit more than 3 national parks in the next 12 months.

reviews.name: Chef Patrick
reviews.title: Our favorite
reviews.comment:
What to say??? Iwe love it we love it we love it.
Our favorite park, we did it so many times, in summer, autumn,,fall and winter.......every period different color and shade, we love it.

reviews.name: Dave N
reviews.title: Surreal
reviews.comment: A must see destination, and make sure you plan a whole day to enjoy the park. I regret only allotting 3 hours to visit this amazing natural wonder. The park offers free shuttle service to major destinations throughout the park. I will definitely be back, so much to see, so little time.

reviews.name: xmiles
reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment:
We have visited many National Parks in America but this one took our breath away.
The hoodoos are simply stunning. There are many viewpoint and you really need to spend a day here to see as many as possible. You can drive your car through the park or take the free shuttle.
Trying to narrow down which are the best viewpoints is difficult but the general consensus is that the first four (Sunrise, Sunset, Inspiration and Bryce) are must sees. I would also recommend Rainbow, Natural Bridge and Fairyland.
Zion is great too but honestly if you could only visit one of them I would pick Bryce over Zion.

reviews.name: Gina S
reviews.title: View is from the top
reviews.comment: Most often, when you see a canyon it is from the top going down and then looking back up. Here, it seemed that the opposite was true. We didn't seem to ever get lower. Of course, the colors remind me of the fall when the trees turn.

reviews.name: JimK761
reviews.title: Well worth your visit
reviews.comment: Very nice park with many trails to hike of all skill levels. You do not have to hike to see the sites just drive along the rim trail and stop at the many scenic viewpoints to have your breath taken away. Be careful if sensitive to high elevations as you are well over 8000 feet

reviews.name: mikebWoodbury
reviews.title: What a Gorgeous Place
reviews.comment: Wow, couldn’t get enough of beautiful Bryce Canyon. Very well managed by our National Park Service. There are several great viewing areas and all kinds of hiking paths that range from strenuous to easy. Don’t miss Bryce.

reviews.name: HappyGJackson
reviews.title: Beautiful hoodoos
reviews.comment: This Park was wonderful the first night we went to see the sunset . The trails were paved and easy to find a parking spot at each area . I loved seeing all the hoodoos I never saw anything like it .

reviews.name: SandstormMayo
reviews.title: One of my favorites
reviews.comment:
We love visiting national parks and Bryce is certainly one of our favorites. The canyon itself can be seen almost entirely from the comforts of the car . There is an 18 mile scenic drive which take you to all of the points. Our favorites were Inspiration Point, Natural Bridge, Ponderosa , and Bryce Point. This drive took us 3-4 hours with plenty of photo stops and short hikes along the rim.
Even though you can see the park by car, we highly recommend taking at least a couple of hikes along the well maintained trails. Some suggestions if you are short on time like us :
1. Navajo trail ( our favorite): moderate, at least see the first few sections and switchbacks.
2. Rim trail : easy
3. Queens Garden : easiest descent into the canyon, but we liked the Navajo descent more.
Navajo and Queens Garden can be combined to do a loop.
The highlight of the trip was the night sky . We cannot recommend this enough. Please go to one of the points , and just look up. You will see the glorious milky way and a million stars.
All in all, we highly recommend this park.

reviews.name: ki0ki
reviews.title: Hoodoos
reviews.comment: Amazing array of hoodoos on this riff. The colors are beautiful and so varied. One picture can encompass all the variety of colors.

reviews.name: Jacques G
reviews.title: What a nice and extraordinary place
reviews.comment: That park must be on your list. It the most beautiful place we have ever visited. During the day and at 2;30 am for the stars and the milky.

reviews.name: Joel C
reviews.title: Photography doesn't cut it!
reviews.comment: This park really needs to be on your bucket list. The pictures you see and take are beautiful, but you really need to be there. We ignored the advice to take the shuttle bus, and used the GyPSy app with our car. This app used GPS to coordinate what the narrator was saying and what we were looking at. We were given directions for our travel once we neared the park, and told what order would be best for viewing. You may be led to believe that you must do hiking as part of your experience. While hiking could well make a better experience, just viewing is other wordly and quite spectacular.

reviews.name: Melinchie T
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: We were just in Bryce Canyon last weekend and it was magnificent.All the views were beautiful and it’s an easy walk. If you have time to stay 2 nights make sure go hiking below the Canyon it’s a moderate hike. It cost $35 to enter the park but it’s for a week entrance. It’s worth a visit

reviews.name: AMsays
reviews.title: An amazing spectacle
reviews.comment:
The free shuttle was the best way to see the park, for us. The bus picked you up from any of 15 points and took you in a loop to the most prominent places like Bryce and Inspiration Points, Sunrise and Sunset Points, as well as the Lodge, VIsitor Centre and the various hotels in the area.
Thee Visitor Centre will give you directions to get the best of your time here. There are ranger programs. The Bryce Amphitheatre Rim has the best views and you can go hiking inside on several different trails. Or you can do the scenic drive which is 18 miles long on your own or on the free 3 hr Rainbow Bus Tour but for this you need reservations.
We saw some amazing rock formations, thousands of hoodoos and sandstone cliffs that have eroded over 70 million years to give you an awesome spectacle.

reviews.name: Peter G
reviews.title: Ranger rim walk--fascinating
reviews.comment: Park rim trail is well maintained, shuttles are timely, everything spotless. Great ranger talk. Great day.

reviews.name: anelizaku
reviews.title: Must Visit, Best Rangers!
reviews.comment: We did the Peek A Boo Loop and Navajo trail hikes here and they were both incredible! The shuttle system is great. We also visited Inspiration Point and Sunset Point with the shuttles. One of the things I noticed about Bryce was how accessible it is. We are not disabled, but I noticed that nearly all of the viewpoints had paved areas and parking very close to the viewpoints for those with mobility issues. I loved it. I felt so lucky that I was able to attend an astronomy program after dark at the lodge and then do a telescope viewing of our planets and galaxies at Sunset Point. The rangers were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable during this. I could have talked to them all night. We also especially loved the rangers directing traffic at the visitors center. You could tell they all genuinely loved their jobs. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.name: HGun
reviews.title: Nature at its finest, Bryce Canyon is a must see of the American West
reviews.comment: We spent 2 days in Bryce and took more pictures than I thought possible, each time we walked along the rim there was another view more beautiful than the last. We also drove along the rim with lots of stops along the way to experience the sights. Sunset and Sunrise are especially powerful. We were lucky to be there for both a full moon, and when the moon rise was at the same time as sunset.

reviews.name: BLRZ
reviews.title: Hiking in Bryce
reviews.comment: Spectacular scenery! Go to Bryce Canyon National Park. Free parking just outside the park to ride the efficient shuttle bus throughout the park. Get off the rim and down into the park to experience the wonders Bryce has to offer. Yes, it is strenuous, and hard. To be among the hoodoos is completely different than looking out over them.

reviews.name: kristine chiong
reviews.title: spectacular views
reviews.comment: one of my favorites- Bryce Canyon National Park with their beautiful rock formation. we had a lot of hiking and so breathtaking. very picturesque!

reviews.name: Cynthia619
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon
reviews.comment: Excellent. Nicely appointed very roomy and spacious modern rooms. Great chuck wagon meal. Excellent entertainment. Would definitely return. Exceptional value

reviews.name: AdventureNik
reviews.title: Amazingly Beautiful.
reviews.comment: This must be one of the most beautiful places in the world. It might not in size be as big as the Grand Canyon, but ecstatically more beautiful with all the hoodoos in different shapes and sizes. You have to walk down in the canyon to really experience it, at least walk down a little, you won’t regret it.

reviews.name: LEEKIM1957
reviews.title: Breathtaking And Unique.
reviews.comment:
This is a must visit beside Zion NP. It's just a couple hours drive from Zion via the beautiful Hwy 9 Zion Scenic Drive and Hwy 89, with so many winding roads and unbelievable views of Zion NP. Don't forget to take some pictures with a couples of drive-thru Arches before reaching Bryce Canyon NP entrance.
There are 4 main viewpoints: Bryce point, Inspiration point, Sunset point and Rainbow Point. IMO, a MUST SEE are Bryce Point and Rainbow Point.
- At the Bryce Point you can view the famous Bryce Amphitheater (it carries the park's name, so most of the highlights are here), whereas countless spires of rock columns also called Hoodoos that carved into the canyon, they formed into an unbelievable views, an unbelievable place on earth. So unique and mind-boggling.
- Rainbow Point is the last viewpoint of the park, it's also at the highest elevation (9,115' to be exact). The panoramic view of the whole Bryce canyon is here. It's just BREATHTAKING. Trust me. You don't want to miss this.
- FYI, if you like to hike, there are trails in each viewpoint, they also have trails that connect between viewpoint, ranging from easy to moderate. Spend at least a day at the park to enjoy all the best that Mother Nature has given us.
Hope this review will help you with some basic info. Now, go explore and enjoy one of the Mighty Five.

reviews.name: Mike S
reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: How can anyone not give this park the highest rating? So many easy, moderate, and challenging hikes. We stayed at the Best Western just on the edge of the park. The free hop on hop off shuttle stops at this top notch hotel every 10 minutes. Of course this park is amazing. Beautiful. Why drive into the park when the free shuttle goes through the park with about 10 stops.

reviews.name: lockandgo
reviews.title: Blown Away With This Park
reviews.comment: Bryce had everything we expected and more. It has hotels, great restaurants, shuttle service and a first class visitor center. You can take a horseback excursion on some of the shared trails. The amphitheater provides views and access for people of all ages and abilities. Take your time and enjoy.

reviews.name: elissahirsch
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon Scenic Tours and Shuttle Service
reviews.comment:
Our family recently tackled Bryce Canyon with Maybry from Bryce Canyon Scenic Tours and Shuttle Service. It was an exhilarating experience, one never to forget.
Maybry is an excellent guide, attentive to our skill level, very patient, making sure we were comfortable with the climb in and out of Bryce. He is a wealth of information and we came away so excited and grateful.
Bryce Canyon Scenic Tours and Shuttle Service is a home grown company. Maybry and his brothers eagerly share their passion of the outdoors with you and will make your visit beyond memorable.

reviews.name: Tamara S
reviews.title: Is there really anything else to say?
reviews.comment: Go... just go. It’s beautiful and less crowded than Zion. Parking wasn’t bad either compared to Zion. They have an optional shuttle if you’d prefer to do that.

reviews.name: ashebroe
reviews.title: Can't believe I waited so long to see this! OH MY GOODNESS!
reviews.comment:
Went in June as a day trip from Zion, where we were staying. Not too long of a drive, and a nice one at that, this is an amazing park! Most of it can be seen without a guided tour, which is what we did. Went up to the end of the road and worked our way back, which was a great way to beat the crowds. Once back at the visitors center, there is a shuttle that will take you to the parts you can't see by car, and the run frequently.
The vistas a views are literally other-worldly. If you want to know what a canyon would look like on anther planet, you don't need to imagine it, as you can see one of Mother Nature's true spectacles, right here on Earth. The pictures shown on the web, pale in comparison to the awe and majesty of this place. DON'T WAIT, GO!

reviews.name: Buenos Nachos
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Probably my favorite of the Utah 5 - the Hoodoos are other-worldly - incredible must see national park.

reviews.name: Chuck S
reviews.title: Our great national parks
reviews.comment: Wonderful, and different. Not just another red rock canyon. Unusual spires. The Rim area is great, but I thought the Navajo Trial was very rewarding for a little effort. Trail gets you INTO the Canyon, a sense of slot canyons, twisted trees, etc. I have a great fear of heights, but this trail was fine. Well surfaced, but not a wheelchair granny trail. After the trail, drive to end of park road, enjoying several scenic stops. One could spend one or several days here. Noted a nice, long bike trail outside the park. Also an extraordinary state park with intense red formations outside park.

reviews.name: 585Rodney585
reviews.title: Awe Enspiring
reviews.comment: What can you say about this National Park that hasn’t been said before. Every which way one turns to see yet another wonderful vista. We stopped at many of the lookout points to be amazed at the colours of the red rocks against the green and brown of the trees. The park was very busy when we visited on a Saturday making parking a premium. Must visit site.

reviews.name: TheGambianRPCV
reviews.title: Yes, this is a complete dreamscape!
reviews.comment:
We visited for the day driving up from Zion. Immediately I wish we had allocated more time.
The rangers at the visitor center were extremely helpful and gave us a few pointers. We took the auto tour and worked in a couple short hikes.
A beautiful place that needs to be explored. Mind your manners on the trails and have a GREAT visit!

reviews.name: Jill
reviews.title: Breath Taking
reviews.comment: RedRock Express Tour Jim was our guide. Traveled through and stopped at picturesque locations! I suggest a good travel log because you will want to remember the details!

reviews.name: Cheryl J
reviews.title: 3 Wonderful and Amazing Days in Bryce Canyon!
reviews.comment: We just returned from 3 wonderful and amazing days in Bryce Canyon! Arriving in late afternoon, we started our experience at Bryce with the Mossy Cave hike and a visit to Fairyland. The following day to get a scope of the park, we did the 18 mile scenic view points, and the Ampitheatre (Inspiration, Sunset, Sunrise, and Bryce Points). The next morning, when crowds were low, we did the Wall Street hike from Sunset Point to the Queens Garden, up to Sunrise Point, and back to Sunset. We followed this with a sunset hike from Sunset Point, down Wall Street, and did the Navajo Loop. The incredible formations, Thor's Hammer and the 3 Sisters, can be viewed at the end of this loop. We highly recommend the Rustler's Restaurant in Tropic. Not only is the food great, but owner, Dallas Clark, is the first genuine cowboy that we have met. He heards 250 head of cattle that he has raised from Tropic to Page every November through back country.

reviews.name: VWilkins1
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: I had dreamed of exploring Bryce Canyon, and I wasn’t disappointed. Only problem was getting into each viewing area. It was so crowded they closed the gates. We drove around other sites and was finally allowed into the best parts of the park. If you go, you might consider taking the free shuttle. They will drop you off to take pictures, hike, and etc. Shuttles run every so many minutes. I bet I took over a hundred pictures. We both throughly enjoyed it.

reviews.name: Dorothy M
reviews.title: Moosie on the move!
reviews.comment: We liked Bryce Canyon as it isn't as crowded as Zion or the south rim of the Grand Canyon. Spend some time, especially at sunrise and sunset to view the changing light and colors on the hoodoos. Bryce Canyon is famous for its worldly unique geology. The erosional force of frost-wedging and the dissolving power of rainwater have shaped the colorful limestone rock of the Claron Formation into bizarre shapes including slot canyons, windows, fins, and spires called “hoodoos.” When we were there we took a horseback ride into the bottom of the canyon. Fabulous! We stayed in the historic cabins close to the rim. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: DrCDB
reviews.title: So beautiful
reviews.comment: So beautiful! The rock formations are so impresive. We did the main hike around the canyon and it was great. So beautiful and not so crowded as other parks in the area.

reviews.name: C H
reviews.title: A unique park and not as crowded as Zion
reviews.comment: First of all, it's not really a canyon but the hoodoos are amazing! Fortunately, the Navajo Loop trail was reopened in June so you could descend into the canyon - go early in the day for the most amazing experience. For those who are challenged, the paved path from Sunrise Point to Sunset Point is easy to maneuver. The rim trail from Bryce Point to Inspiration Point and then to Sunset Point, also provides outstanding views. If you do use the bus system, they only go as far as Bryce Point. To see the complete park, you will need to drive your own vehicle. They do offer extended tours (check the schedule at the Visitor's Center) and the drivers are quite knowledgeable about the area.

reviews.name: lka0806
reviews.title: Bryce Canyon Experience
reviews.comment: Beautiful place to visit! We were not able to hike but we still took in all the lookout points. Some points were harder to hike to but for the most part easy! We stayed in Panguitch, but it is a dry town.

reviews.name: amsterdam05
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery
reviews.comment: We had been here decades ago and had forgotten how beautiful the scenery is. The park itself is really big, you need a car to go from place to place.

reviews.name: Donan B
reviews.title: Great rim views
reviews.comment:
Amazing sights. Hoodoos exceptional from varied viewpoints.
Best view is sunset view point above the path..

reviews.name: Miekekarregat
reviews.title: Gorgious trails
reviews.comment:
Very very beautiful national park. You can see all viewpoints by jumping on the shuttle bus so everything is possible with your kids. The only walk which is accesible with the stroller is between sunset and sunrise they say. But we did Queens garden, Navajo loop and sunset to inspiration point with the stroller as well.
